loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is 31 years old and married.  She deals in business selling livestock with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up and then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. She needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase more animals to boost her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to boost her sales.

loans.name: Alh. Musa

texts.en: Alh. Musa is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh. Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after the harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Musa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 percent higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Alh. Musa is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.es:
Emanuel, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en alquiler juntamente con sus abuelos ocupando una habitación pero comparte las demás dependencias con sus abuelos, las paredes están revocadas con estuco y el piso es de tablones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en La Paz.
Actualmente Emanuel ha terminado unos estudios en la realización de protesis dentales, trabajo que generalmente lo hace por la noche pues durante el día sigue trabajando como procurador en un bufet de abogados realizando tramites de legalización.
Emanuel quiere crédito para comprar material para elaborar protesis dentales ya que no puede hacerlo por su cuenta, su salario no le alcanca para cubrir todas sus necesidades
texts.en:
Emanuel is single and has no children. He rents from his grandparents, occupying his own bedroom, but sharing the rest of the space with his grandparents. The walls are stucco-covered and the floor is wood. The house is located in the Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz.

He has now completed some studies on making dental prosthesis.  He generally does this work at night.  During the day he continues working as a lawyer at a law firm doing legal transactions.

Emanuel wants the loan to buy material to make dental prosthesis.  He is not able to do so on his own.  His salary is not enough to cover all of his necessities.

loans.use: to buy material to make dental prosthesis.

loans.name: Sharaf

texts.en:
Sharaf is a 19 year old, single man from Ramallah city. He has an electronics repair workshop. He also sells computers and accessories. This is the only source of income for his family. Sharaf would like to improve his workshop and expand it in the future.

Sharaf is taking a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more computer repair parts for his workshop. By taking this loan, Sharaf will be able to increase his productivity and also his sales.
Sharaf appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more computer repair parts for his workshop.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 19-year-old single lady from a village near Jenin city. She lives with her family in a small simple house. Her father has a meat shop in the city. Faten is a student in a local university where she studies finance. She wants to complete her study and find a job to improve her family's living conditions.

Faten took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, she will be able to complete her study faster and improve herself.

Faten appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy repair parts and car accessories for his workshop.

loans.name: Loay

texts.en:
Loay is an 18-year-old single man from Rafah city. He works in transferring goods using a rental rickshaw. He earns a low income and this is the only source of income for the family. Loay would like to improve his family's living so he decided to buy rickshaw to transfer goods.

Loay took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for his business. By taking this loan, Loay will be able decrease the rental expenses he had before.

Loay appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for his business.

loans.name: Muinjon

texts.en:
Muinjon was born in 1995. He is married, and his wife is a housewife.

Muinjon studies at the Tajikistan Economy University. He is a student of the second course. He gets excellent marks. Muinjon is learning banking. He dreams to be a high-quality specialist and to work for developing his Tajikistan.

Muinjon is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Ruhshona

texts.en:
Ruhshona was born in 1985. She is married and has 3 children. She sews for a living. Ruhshona has provided sewing services to local people for more than 2 years. She continually improves her knowledge and abilities little by little with the passing of time.

Ruhshona now needs financial support because her child is ill and she must buy medicines for her child's treatment. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy medicines.

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment.

loans.name: Mohru

texts.en: Mohru was born in 1987. She is married and has three children. She is a very hardworking woman. She is a seamstress and has been busy with a sewing service for more than a year. She is developing her business little by little and she attracts more clients day by day because she sews carefully. Her husband’s income is small and she is the main provider for her children. She must buy wood to keep her house warm in the winter season because her children are little but she doesn't have the money. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy wood. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy wood to keep her house warm in the winter season.

loans.name: Rigoberta

texts.es: Rigoberta de 50 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos de 10, 12 y 15 años de edad y dos mayores de edad que le apoyan con los gastos de su hogar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que toda su vida se ha dedicado a cultivar la tierra, por lo que se dedica a vender los productos que cultiva como: ejotes, frijoles, maíz y tomates. Rigoberta anteriormente obtuvo un crédito con la institución, el que utilizó para construir una pila  por lo que se siente muy contenta dado que ahora ya puede contar con el agua potable cerca de su casa. En esta ocasión,  solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir un muro en su vivienda que le permita dar una mayor seguridad a los suyos en esta época de inseguridad en la que se encuentra el país.
texts.en:
Rigoberta is 50 years old. She lives in a house that she owns together with her husband and their five children. The children are 10, 12, and 15 years old; two others are adults who contribute to the household expenses. She is a resourceful woman who has worked all her life in cultivating the earth; she earns her living selling the produce that she grows, including green beans, beans, corn, and tomatoes. 

Previously, Rigoberta obtained a loan from the institution, which she used to build a water storage basin. She feels very happy given that she can now have potable water close to her house.

At this time, she is requesting a new loan from FUSAI to invest in brick, cement, sand, gravel, and metal to construct a wall at her house; this will give her loved ones greater security during this dangerous time in her country.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand, gravel, and metal to build a wall in her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and a boat engine

loans.name: Yolly

texts.en: Yolly is a married woman and a mother of three children from San Dionisio, Iloilo.  Yolly runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and food items to the people in her place. Yolly has been in the business for more than five years now. Yolly is asking to take a loan to buy more stocks to sell like bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, canned goods, noodles, condiments and others. With a loan, she will be able to improve her stocks thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Yolly hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, canned goods, noodles, condiments and other items

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
HELLO! Meet Everlyne, 44 years of age and a proud mother of three. She is very ambitious and enterprising, and a go-getting woman who hails from the Kitale area of Kenya. She has been doing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income are egg selling, milk selling, and some personal business that she does to make ends meet. Everlyne loves farming, taking really good care of her dairy cows and even nicknaming her cow. The Kitale area has favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming: good soil, good climate, a good transport system and a ready market for horticulture products. Everlyne wants to take advantage and start horticultural farming. She is seeking a loan to get her started and, through improved income, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure her children's futures. The financial benefits that Everlyne will reap are almost immediate; hence, she will be assured of a secure future. She plans to start exporting her horticulture to international markets once she has accumulated more profit.

Her greatest wish is to have a large horticulture farm that generates good earnings and creates jobs.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Gina works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Gina is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ducks and high quality feed.

loans.name: Thann

texts.en:
Thann, 20, lives with family members in a rural village of the Takeo province. He is single. Nowadays, he still studies in university, and he can earn income via working in his university. He can earn income of about 2.5 USD per day.

This is Thann’s first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He will spend his entire loan portion to pay his tuition fee for a bachelor’s degree with a major in Management. He hopes that he gets a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee for a bachelor's degree with a major in Management.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes and resell them in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Los Trabajadores De Juan Pablo Group

texts.es:
El Sr. JOSE LIBORIO, tiene 51 años de edad, él forma parte del grupo "Los Trabajadores de Juan Pablo" constituido aproximadamente hace un año, actualmente está formado por siete socios.
Desde hace mas de 21 años el Sr. José Liborio es maestro de construcción, inició su trabajo siendo operario, aprendió sobre éste trabajo hasta que se le presentó la oportunidad de dirigir y tener personal a cargo. Actualmente ésta actividad es la que le brinda lo necesario para el sustento de su familia. Gracias a su trabajo ha podido sacar adelante a sus tres hijos que están en camino a ser independientes.
El, préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su maquinaria para construcción.
texts.en:
Sr. José Liborio is 51-years old.  He is a member of the "Los Trabajadores de Juan Pablo" (The Workers of Juan Pablo) communal bank, which formed about a year ago.  There are currently seven members.  
For more than 21 years, Sr. José Liborio has been a master carpenter.  He started out as a worker and learned about construction until he was presented with the opportunity to manage and have his own personnel.  The work currently provides him with what he needs to support his family.  Thanks to his work, Sr. José Liborio has been able to get his three children ahead and on the path to being independent. 
The loan he has received will be invested in maintaining his construction equipment.

loans.use: to invest in construction equipment maintenance.

loans.name: Kasindi Bus Women Group

texts.en: Jackline is 35 years old and married with six children. She is a member of Kasindi Bus Women group, living in Kasese Uganda. Jackline has sold timber since 2009 in order to earn a living. She has a dream of becoming rich and expanding her timber business to the city. However, she is faced with a challenge of poor roads and price changes. Jackline intends to use the loan to buy to buy timber for selling.

loans.use: to buy timber for selling.

loans.name: Ashran

texts.en: Ashran is 35 years old, married and is the mother of three children. She has been doing a business of livestock sales and purchase for many years with her husband's support. Ashran is keen to provide her family with better living conditions. Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Andrawus

texts.en: Andrawus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Andrawus joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Joshua, Inusa and Anas.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Andrawus would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Andrawus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Andrawus  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en: Sakeena is 54 years old, married and has four children. She has run a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She keeps buffaloes for milking purposes. Her husband sells the milk on his motorbike door-to-door. Her business is doing well enough to pay her family’s expenses. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Meet Faith, a mother, who has been farming for six years. She lives with her family on family-owned land in the Kerugoya, Kenya. Faith sells milk, eggs, maize and various food crop varieties from her farm to earn a living. Faith is very passionate about horticultural farming. However, she faces market challenges such as low prices and low demand in certain seasons. Faith joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that provides both training and financing to smallholder rural farmers. She learned about loan management during the training sessions. She is now seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase horticultural inputs. With the loan, Faith will pay the input expenses that are beyond her means at the moment. With the inputs, she is set to achieve not only a great quantity, but also high-quality yields. With the additional income from horticulture, Faith will comfortably complete her loan repayments. She seeks to improve her family’s living standards.
Support the enterprising dreams of a Kenyan with a loan today!

loans.use: To purchase horticulture inputs

loans.name: Twanzane Traders Group

texts.en: Florence is 48 years old, single with two children and lives in Kasese Uganda. She is a member of Twanzane Traders Group which used the previous loan to buy crude salt for selling. Florence sells crude salt and has been in that business for 10 years, She also owns a salt pan and a retail shop of general merchandise. She has a dream of educating her children. Florence is faced with the challenge of seasonality factors. Florence will use the loan to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.name: Mahmadamin

texts.en: Mahmadamin is married and has two children. He is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life for his children. Mahmadamin began his own business dealing in animal husbandry when his children were little. He has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to increase the number of animals he has for sale. He hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve his family's income.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing his working capital

loans.name: Mahina

texts.en: Mahina is a seamstress. She lives in a rural area. Mahina is divorced and lives with her child. Mahina sews variety of women's clothes and has been working in this way for more than five years. Mahina is the only breadwinner of her family and that’s why she works hard. Mahina needs your financial support because her child is ill. She must buy medicines for the treatment of her child but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment of her child. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicine for the treatment of her child

loans.name: Casimera

texts.en:
Casimera is a married woman with five children from Talibon, Bohol. Two of her children are still attending school. She engages in a food vending business. She makes and sells snack food locally known as "binangkal", a sesame-covered baking powder doughnut that is shaped and is as small as a ping-pong ball. It is deep fried until crisp and brown on the outside. Aside from that, Casimera also raises and sells hogs. During planting season, she also grows and sells rice.

She is asking for a loan to buy flour and purchase farming supplies like fertilizers and an additional pig. These will help Casimera and her family, improve her food vending business, gain a higher yield for her farm and raise and sell healthy pigs in the coming months. In these ways, she will be able to continue support the education of her children.

Casimera dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and sustainable for the coming future.

loans.use: to buy flour, farming supplies like fertilizers and an additional pig

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Timothy is forty-eight years old and married. Together with his spouse, he has been blessed with four children. He does horticulture farming and has been in this business for twenty-four years. The business is profitable and he currently makes a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

He plans to use this loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seedlings for planting. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children up to university level. 

This is Timothy’s first loan from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to be the best horticulture farmer, make more income and to be able educate his children and have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Rizvona

texts.en: Rizvona was born in 1971. She is widowed and has two children. She is very kind and a hard-working woman. Rizvona has worked for more than eight years in a café as a cleaning woman. She takes her job honestly and her colleagues like her very much. She is the sole breadwinner of her family and her salary is not enough to provide her children with all their needs. So, they live poorly. Rizvona is asking for a loan in the amount of 5,000 Somoni to buy medicine because her daughter is ill. She must buy medicines for her treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicine for treatment

loans.name: Gul  Nisa

texts.en: 39-year-old Gul Nisa is a married woman with two children. The man shown in the photo is her husband along with her one son. Her husband has been running a food stall for a period of about two years. He earns sufficient income to cover the family’s expenditures. For the improvement of her husband’s business, Gul Nisa has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to buy crockery and utensils along with stocks of oil, spices and food items. It will help him to increase his sales and profits as well.

loans.use: to buy crockery and utensils along with stocks of oil, spices and food items.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Rosemary, 37 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Maili saba, a remote village in Kitale. She is happily married and is blessed with seven adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business.

The Kitale area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 15,000 KES to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging. Through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. This will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Afsheen

texts.en:
Afsheen is a 29-year-old married woman. She deals in a business of selling garments and cosmetics items. Over time she has gained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

From time to time she needs to deal with more customers. For the improvement of her business she has gotten a loan of 30,000 PKR from Murabaha. It helped her in purchasing more collections of ladies' garments in the latest style for increasing her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase more collections of ladies' garments in the latest styles for increasing sales and profits.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos de 06 años y 01 año de edad respectivamente en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. Es un distrito mediano en el cuál la población se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería, comercio, etc.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales de corral como son cuyes, gallinas, patos, entre otros, cuenta con más de 04 años de experiencia en el rubro y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento del lugar donde cría a sus animales así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Con esto Wilmer espera aumentar la productividad de su negocio logrando mejorar su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 31 years old and lives in common law marriage with his partner and 2 younger children of 6 and 1 years old. He lives in the district of Pucará, in the province of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Perú. It is a medium-sized district, with a population engaged in agriculture, livestock, trade, etc.

He makes a living breeding and selling barnyard animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, ducks, etc. He has over 4 years of experience in the business and has very good personal and work references in the area. 

This loan will be used to make repairs and perform maintenance on the space where he breeds and also to purchase balanced food for feeding the animals. As a result, Wilmer expects to increase the productivity of his business, improve his standard of income, and thus improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to make repairs and perform maintenance on the space where he breeds his animals and to purchase balanced food to feed them.

loans.name: Al- Jadar Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Jadar. It consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Anisa is the leader of the group. She is a married woman of forty-three years and a mother of three children. She works as a guard in a private school with a small salary. She doesn't have a television inside the house and this makes her feels inconvenienced. All the members of the family hope to watch some programs on television when they finish their work. Anisa's salary is not enough to purchase it. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a television for the house.

Anisa hopes to start her own business by opening a small grocery in the area where she lives.

loans.use: To purchase a television for the house.

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en: Ayesha is a twenty-nine-year-old married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been successfully running a small general store for many years. He has retained many customers over the years and makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. For the improvement of her husband's business, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to buy stocks of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet customers’ demand, so that they can increase the store's revenues.

loans.use: to buy salt, biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos vive en una comunidad de Solola, él tiene 48 años de edad, tiene una familia de 10 hijos y una parte de sus hijos aun están estudiando. 

Santos desde hace 5 años trabaja en la agricultura él siembra papa, zanahoria entre otras verduras, la iniciativa de Santos para trabajar la agricultura es por sus hijos, porque tiene dos hijos, graduados en la  carrera de agroturismo, con la experiencia y la formación ellos apoyan ahora a su papá para esta actividad, pero el obstáculo que Santos tiene es que no cuenta con capital de trabajo, pues Santos  y sus hijos  tomaron la decisión de conseguir un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para la agricultura. 

Santos no solo se dedica a la agricultura, él trabaja también como conserje y jardinero para una institución, pero no es suficiente para la generación de ingresos económicos, porque  su familia es numerosa, Santos está feliz porque ahora tendrá el apoyo de sus hijos en la agricultura tanto en trabajos físicos, como intelectuales, el sueño de santos es mejorar los procesos de siembra para lograr mejores cosechas, y con lo que genera la agricultura, podrá mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Santos lives in the community of Solola. He is 48,  has a family of 10 children and some of the children are still going to school.

Santos has been farming for five years. He grows potatoes, carrots, and other vegetables. Santos' initiative in agriculture is for the sake of his children because he has two children who have graduated in the career of agritourism. With their experience and the training, they now help their father in  this activity. The obstacle Santos has is that he doesn't have working capital.  So Santos and his children have taken the decision to obtain a loan to purchase fertilizers and agricultural supplies.

Santos is not only engaged in agriculture.  He also works as a janitor and gardener for an institution, but that this is not enough to generate income because he has a numerous family. 

Santos is happy because now he will have the help of his children with his farming, both in the physical and intellectual work. His dream is to improve his farming processes in order to obtain better harvests, and with what his farming generates be able to improve his home.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Kamengo United Group

texts.en: Oliva is a widow living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is member of Kamengo United Group, where each member guarantees the others to repay their loans. She is a retailer and at the same time, raises farm animals like cattle and goats. He faces challenges of expensive drugs and customers who delay paying her. However, she has hopes of expanding her farm business to new areas. Oliva needs a loan to buy more sugar, cooking oil and salt to sell in her retail business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, cooking oil and  salt to sell.

loans.name: Alisabatu

texts.en: Alisabatu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Alisabatu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children, Emma, Hassan and Ketura.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Alisabatu would have had to sell her maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alisabatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Alisabatu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure other members of her community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en: Gulzar  is 35 years old.  She is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 50,000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en: Inusa is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Inusa would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Inusa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Inusa expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: El Valerio Group

texts.es:
El grupo “El Valerio” se encuentra en una comunidad muy alejada, se debe caminar casi durante media hora ya que tampoco hay servicio de transporte. 
Las integrantes del grupo son personas trabajadoras, siempre hacen lo que está en sus manos para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Ahora que la cosecha de maíz ha iniciado ellos se contratan como jornaleros para trabajar en el campo. 
Doña Celedonia es una persona muy sencilla, tiene 49 años y está casada con el señor Francisco. Tienen una familia con seis hijos aunque ya sólo una pequeñita de seis años depende de ellos. Don Francisco trabaja en la construcción de casas, pero por ahora no participa en ningún proyecto por lo que pasa la mayor parte del tiempo en el campo. 
Desde hace 30 años, Celedonia inició a críar y vender animales como borregos, cerdos y becerros. “Desde que me casé, quise ayudar con los gastos del hogar y la educación de mis niños” así que comenzó a realizar la actividad que ya conocía. Celedonia compra los animalitos y los conserva durante cuatro o cinco meses, tiempo en que los debe cuidar y alimentar muy bien para poder obtener más ganancias. 
Celedonia necesita invertir en bultos de alimento para los tres becerros que también está a punto de comprar. Recientemente, su esposo terminó de arreglar el corral que tenían, era muy pequeño y ahora está listo para recibir a los becerros que necesitan más espacio. 
Muy emocionada, Doña Celedonia comenta que le encanta atender a sus animales porque son el sustento para su familia, aunque su única dificultad es cuando llegan a enfermar, pero entonces el veterinario la visita hasta su casa. 
El único sueño de Doña Celedonia es poder seguir apoyando a su hija más pequeña, le encantaría que la niña terminara una carrera profesional.
Todas las integrantes del grupo están muy contentas porque el préstamo les ayudará a mejorar su negocio: Doña María L. invertirá en ropa; Patricia, en pollos; María E. y Alberta, en borregos y Doña Concepción, en sus bordados. Todas ellas también se dedican a crear artesanías bordadas, como es típico en la región aunque las utilizan para adornar sus mesas o  los canastos de tortillas. 

*La foto fue tomada afuera de la casa de Doña Celedonia y todas las integrantes muestran alguno de sus bordados, Doña Celedonia es la primera a mano izquierda y lleva un sombrero*
texts.en:
“El Valerio” is a group that lives in a remote community: it is necessary to walk for almost half an hour to reach it, and there is no transportation services.
The members of the group are hardworking people always doing everything they can to improve their standard of living. Now that the corn harvesting has begun, they work as day laborer in the county.
Celedonia is a very simple woman. She is 49 years old, she is married with Francisco and they have six children, even though only their six-year-old daughter depends on them. Francisco works in construction, but at the moment he is not working at any project because he spends the majority of his time in the country.
Around 30 years ago, Celedonia started breeding and selling animals such as lambs, pigs and calves. She says, “since I got married, I have wanted to help paying for the household expenses and for my children’s education”; she then started running the activity she already had experience in. Celedonia buys the animals and keeps them for four or five months: during this time she breeds and feeds them very well in order to earn more money.
Celedonia needs to buy bags of food for the three calves she is about to buy. Her husband has recently finished repairing their yard, as it was very small: now it is ready to welcome the calves who need more space.
Celedonia is greatly moved when she says that she loves caring for her animals, because it is through them that she can provide for her family; she faces challenges only when they get sick, but luckily the vet visits the animals directly in her house.
Celedonia has only one dream: to succeed in keeping on providing for her youngest daughter, as she would love for her to have a professional career.
All the members of the group are very happy because the loan will help them improve their activities: Maria L. will buy clothes, Patricia will buy chickens, María E and Alberta will buy lambs, and Concepción will increase her embroidery activity. They all engage in creating embroidered handicrafts, as it is typical of their region. They use these crafts to decorate their tables of to trim their tortillas hampers.
*The picture has been taken outside Celedonia’s house and all the members are showing some of their embroidery. Celedonia is the first from the left and wears a hat.

loans.use: To buy bags of animal feed.

location.town: El Valerio San Jose del Rincon.

loans.name: Barasita

texts.en: Barasita is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be vision oriented. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more ingredients for preparing food she sells. Her business goal is to own a bigger hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food she sells. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food she sells

loans.name: Kakoni Traders Group

texts.en: Happy used the previous loan to buy salt for selling. Happy is a 33 year-old, female  who is married and has four children.  They live in Kasese, Uganda. A member of Kakoni traders group, Happy sells salt and has been operating that business for five years. She also does fish mongering to get additional income. She has a dream of educating her children and becoming rich. However, she is faced with the challenge of climatic changes. Happy  wants money to buy salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Huda Al- Khafji Group

texts.en:
This group is called Huda Al- Khafji. It consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.

Jamala is the leader of the group. She is forty-three years old, married and a mother of four children. She lives with her family in a humble house. She is uneducated and works as a housewife. All the members of the family depend on the salary of the father who is an immigrant outside of the country and works with a monthly salary. The money that he sends monthly for his family in Yemen is not enough to cover all the family needs. The house where Jamala lives with her children lacks a refrigerator and she can't purchase one. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a refrigerator to keep water, drinks and food cold.

Jamala hopes to provide her house with all home appliances.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia, aged thirty-four, is a married woman.  She deals in a business selling animals with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of six children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. Currently she has accessed a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR. It allowed her to purchase another buffalo to generate greater revenues in the future.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en: Natasha is a twenty-one-year-old lady. The man shown in the picture is her brother. For about two years, she has been working in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are in high demand and she has managed to build a group of clients that allow her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has taken a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater more consistently to her customer's demands. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en: Kiran is a twenty-five-year-old married woman. Her husband is running a business of furniture making. The man shown in the photo is Kiran’s husband. Over time he has become famous for providing good quality furniture in her community. She is a responsible mother of two children and is liable to provide them with the basic necessities of life. For the improvement of her husband’s business she has availed Murabaha of 25,000 PKR to purchase good quality wood with the packs of polish and nails in larger quantity to cater to more customers without delay, which ultimately helps in bringing more cash home. Kiran dreams of providing a bright and prosperous future to her children.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood, packs of polish and nails

loans.name: Unión Y Fortaleza  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Unión Y fortaleza se reúne cada quince días en Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
Este grupo está integrado por 11 mujeres y 2 hombres, este es un grupo personas muy humildes y trabajadoras que al enterarse de los beneficios que les brinda la institución decidieron unirse tiempo atrás  y formar este grupo el cual les ha ayudado mucho para salir adelante. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la artesanía, comercio en general, entre otras actividades.
Forma parte de este grupo a la señora Liliana, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 8, 6 y 5 años de edad, todos ellos estudian en escuela. Su marido tiene una fábrica de bloques. 
Doña Liliana es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en sus actividades, el tiene una fábrica de bloques que el con la ayuda de dos operarios elaboran los bloques los mismos que son muy utilizados en el campo de la construcción, mientras él se encarga de esta actividad ella es la encargada de las ventas y pedidos pues ellos venden en la fabrica y también entregan en una distribuidora en Manta, ya son siete años con su negocio el cual les permite salir adelante y también generara ingresos en las familias de las personas que laboran con ellos.
Este crédito es para comprar piedra, arena y cemento. Este es su segundo  ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos les ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir aumentando su negocio y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Unión Y Fortaleza” (Unity and Strength) meets every 15 days in Montecristi, which is known for its pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have been recognized on a national and international level. This place is also known for its straw hats.

This group consists of 11 women and 2 men. They are humble and hardworking individuals who will be discovering the benefits that ESPOIR has to offer. The members decided to join together some time ago and form this group, which has been a great help in getting ahead. They engage in different business activities such as handicrafts, general trade, and other ventures.

One member of this group is Sra. Liliana. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children (ages 8, 6, and 5). All of them attend school. Her husband owns and operates a block factory.

Doña Liliana is a good wife who will designate her loan for her husband to use in his activities. He owns a block factory and has the help of two workers in making blocks that are frequently used in the construction sector. While her husband is in charge of production, Liliana is responsible for sales and taking orders for products sold from the factory. They are also responsible for making deliveries to Manta. Liliana and her husband have been in this business for seven years and it has allowed them to get ahead. In addition, the business generates incomes for the families of the people who work for them.

This loan will be used to buy stone, sand, and cement. Liliana is participating in her second loan cycle with the Communal Bank and she enjoys being a member because the loans have been a great help. Her dreams include continuing to increase her business and to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy stone, sand, and cement for making concrete blocks.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a thirty-seven-year-old, hardworking woman who has four children. She has been providing a service of stitching clothes in her locality for many years. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Bushra’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good customer base. Currently, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 56-year-old married woman. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Nusrat has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires as well as some spare parts and tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers.

 Nusrat is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires as well as some spare parts and tools for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 46-year-old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  

Salma’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. 

Therefore, Salma has requested 45,000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to provide milk to more customers, thus providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to provide milk to more customers, thus providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel, 49 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Mabel needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 45,000  to buy additional grocery items, including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. in order to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items, including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. so she can consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.name: Alisabatu

texts.en: Alisabatu is a maize farmer from Pegi village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Alisabatu would have had to sell her maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alisabatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Alisabatu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and hopes to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for her family  thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a maize farmer from Maidawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Yahaya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina is 38 years old and a  married woman. The man shown in the photo is Sakina’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Sakina has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires along with auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Sakina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with auto spare parts.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: Ivan es soltero y vive con su hermana menor a quien cuida y quiere mucho, los dos viven en La Paz y pagan un alquiler Ivan y su hermana subsisten vendiendo almuerzos a obreros de construcciones de La Paz, la hermana también estudia por las tardes, ella tiene 18 años Ivan quiere comprar una maquina que le permita hacer pollos al spiedo que planea vender por las noches, Ivan espera que su hermana termine sus estudios y tenga mejor formación Ivan agradece que su caso haya sido publicado en Kiva
texts.en:
Ivan is single and lives with his younger sister whom he cares for and loves very much.  The two of them live in La Paz and pay rent.  Ivan and his sister subsist on selling lunches to construction workers in La Paz.  His sister also goes to school in the afternoon.  She is 18 years old. 

Ivan wants to buy a machine that would allow him to make rotisserie chicken that he plans to sell in the evening.  Ivan hopes that his sister will complete her studies and will have a better education. 

Ivan is thankful that his case has been put on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a machine so he can sell rotisserie chicken.

loans.name: Usaini

texts.en: Usaini is a maize farmer from Kadanya Biyar village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Usaini would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to take care of his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Usaini can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Usaini, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ann Njeri

texts.en:
Ann is 41 years old, is married to Paul and they are both farmers in Thika. They have two children.

She  has been farming for the past five years and supports a family of two children.

She is in her third loan cycle with VisionFund Kenya.  She will use the loan to buy a cooking stove.
With the anticipated profits, she hopes to improve her business. She hopes that through her farming activities, she will be able to improve the living standards of her children.

loans.use: Personal use - to buy a cooking stove

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 42-year-old married father of two children. He is acquiring this loan to pay for his children's school tuition fees. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Hasan hopes to stay capable of providing his children with the necessary living needs, and developing their social situation.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Edith Greta tiene 27 años de edad, ella es socia del grupo "Las Amigas" que está integrado por cinco socias, todas ellas unidas bajo un mismo propósito que es sacar adelante sus negocios.
Hace más de tres años, inició su negocio de cabinas de internet, el cual ubicó en un espacio de su casa, empezó con pocas máquinas, adicionaba el servicio de tipeos e impresiones para poder generar otro ingreso, tuvo algunos inconvenientes porque actualmente muchos de sus antiguos clientes cuentan con servicio de internet en su casa y ha perdido esos clientes, pero su negocio aún se sostiene con las impresiones y tipeos además del alquiler de las computadoras.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la aplicación de antivirus a sus computadoras ya que requieren de éste servicio para que estén funcionando sin problemas.
texts.en:
Edith Greta is 27 years old. She is a member of the group 'Las Amigas', which is made up of 5 members who are all united by the same purpose which is to progress with their businesses.
Over three years ago, Edith Greta started her business of internet booths, which she installed in a space in her house. She began with just a few machines and she then added typing and printing services to be able to create another income. She has had a few disadvantages because now many of her former customers have internet in their homes and she has lost these customers. However her business still sustains itself with the typing and printing services as well as the renting of computers.
The loan received will be invested in applying antivirus software to the computers as they need this service so that they work without problems.

loans.use: to invest in applying antivirus software to her computers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies and to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Saxavat

texts.en:
Saxavat is a 26-year-old single man who lives with his parents in the Agdas region. He is a kind and hardworking man. According to his friends’ opinions, Saxavat is very outgoing and welcoming. 

He couldn’t get a higher education, and because of that he decided to start his own business. He chose farming. He is growing fruits and vegetables in his own yard.

Saxavat has 7 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, but his situation is very hard. He needs to raise fruits and care for them, but the lack of water in the region makes that a problem for him. 

Because of this problem, the productivity has fallen, and he can’t cover the family’s needs. He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to be able to supply water to his garden weekly. This will increase the productivity again, and the family’s income will rise.

loans.use: to supply water to his garden weekly.

loans.name: Tupo Juu Sana Group

texts.en:
Tatu, who is in her mid-30s, is married with four children who are still in school.  She has been selling bites together with juice, which she makes herself, and water for nine years now. She works from 6 am to 11 am daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Tatu's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy rice, baking flour, cooking flour, juice, sugar, fruits to make juice, and water to meet her customers' demands.  She dreams of taking her kids to good schools. 

Tatu will share this loan with her loan group "Tupo Juu Sana" which consists of 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, baking flour, cooking flour, juice, sugar, fruits to make juice. and water to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: Gulchehra is 41 year old. She is an industrious woman. Gulchehra is a careful mother of four children. She works hard from early morning until late evening in the land, which is situated at her house. Gulchehra grows potatoes and sells them in a local market. She has worked in this field for more than six years. Her husband helps her with managing the business. Gulchehra also uses vegetables for her household from her own land. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy seeds of potatoes and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds of potatoes and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 39 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 3 children. He does farming in Thika town and he has been in this business for 14 years and it has been profitable. 

He plans to use this loan to buy farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer for use on his farm. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his farming methods and get more farm products. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to improve his farming and become the best farmer in the area.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 29 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with one child aged 3 years. Christine does farming and has been in this business for four years. She also has a tailoring business and it has been profitable. 

She plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting on her farm. She will also buy textile materials for use in her tailoring business. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and give good health for her children. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 40 years old. She is married to Mbuvi and together they have been blessed with 3 young children.

Anna is a farmer, a business she has practiced for the last 14 years, earning a monthly income of about Kshs 30,000.

Anna has requested her 3rd loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs 59,500, which she will use to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers, seedlings and sprays. She will also set aside wages for her laborers.

With the anticipated profits, Anna will be able to educate her children fully.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her farming business in order to produce high yields, and to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Most of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment and lack of capital. This is true for Nancy, 32, who is based in the Eldoret area of Kenya and is a mother of one lovely child. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. She has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated “feeding my cows.” Her hobby is milking Browny (the name of her dairy cow). She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet the demand. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit margins and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Nancy is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling, and also to start selling dairy products such as yogurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.
Support Nancy so that she can continue with her dairy farming!

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old and has two children. With one child in school, Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Maria is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Maria has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to sell. 

Maria is committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Scola

texts.en: Hello! Meet Scola, an ever-smiling young farmer who is responsible and has had to overcome many difficulties through her life. However, she has always found the strength to move forward and to keep growing in her life. She has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. She is the proud owner of a small parcel of land, on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. Her primary sources of income are selling eggs and milk, and through this venture she has earned a decent income. She also engages in personal business in order to make ends meet. Scola passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early riser and wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cows. Although this humble mum has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. Scola is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. With the loan capital, she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will help to fully satisfy the demand. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money in order to repay the loan fully and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mebo

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Mebo, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kaplamai, a remote village in Kitale. She is 61, happily married and blessed with five adorable children.

Mebo has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained a lot of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaged in another small business as well.

The Kitale area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, Mebo finds poultry farming very enjoyable but also stated that the best part is “the increased profits I enjoy.”

Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand for her chicken products, which is very high. However, she lacks the money to build up her farm, so she is seeking a loan of 40,000 KES to buy more chickens. As a woman, getting a loan is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva her dream will be realized. She will be able to sell more eggs and chicken products to her neighbors and in the local market.

Being a visionary woman, Mebo sees the results of this loan increasing her income and permanently improving her living conditions. The extra income she gets will be used repay her loan and secure the future of her child now in school.

Mebo knows that with the help of Kiva lenders she will be able to go far!

loans.use: To buy more chickens for her farm.

loans.name: Mari Grace

texts.en:
Mari Grace is 26 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Mari Grace is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Mari Grace has been in this business for one year, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 35 years old. She is married and has five children aged between 6 and 17 years.  All of them go to school. She sells food stuffs and has been in a business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans for sale.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a woman with one child whom in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marlyn is 37 years old now.

Marlyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan on November 8, 2013. Marlyn requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to  buy additional boxes of fish to sell to restart her business activities.

Marlyn has been in this business for two years, and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Marlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Domithile

texts.en: Domithile is aged 42. She is married with eight children aged between one and 22 years. All of them go to school. She sells clothes and has been in the business for 20 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more clothes for selling. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Taylor Xavier

texts.es:
Taylor vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima agradable. Es una ciudad muy comercial la misma que es considerada puerto terrestre que une a la sierra y a la costa. Taylor es un joven de 19 años, vive con sus padres en el Rcto Las Delicias, recinto límite entre santo Domingo y Manabí, sector cálido y muy productivo.
Taylor trabaja todos los días en un kiosco que a base de su esfuerzo pudo obtenerlo, ahí atiende hasta horas de la noche donde prepara deliciosos batidos, tostadas y jugos. Por ser un sector cálido le va bien en sus ventas, está bien ubicado junto a una escuela.
Taylor acudió a la institución, con este crédito él podrá hacer unas mejoras en su kiosco, lo quiere adecuar mejor y además comprar más vasos y demás. Se siente feliz porque ninguna otra institución quiso darle la mano, agradece enormemente al equipo de Fundación Alternativa por apoyarle.
texts.en:
Taylor, 19, lives in the coastal region, in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, a city with a pleasant climate.  It's a very commercial city that's considered a land port that unites the mountains and the coast.

Taylor lives with his parents in the Las Delicias area, the boundary between Santo Domingo and Manabí, a warm and very productive area.  Taylor works every day in a kiosk he acquired with his efforts.  He serves delicious smoothies, tostadas [a local snack], and juices into the evening.  He's doing well in his sales because it's a warm area that's well located next to a school.

Taylor turned to the institution.  With this loan he'll be able to make some improvements to his kiosk.  He wants to better adapt it and buy some more glasses and other things.

He's happy because no other institution wanted to help him out.  He's enormously grateful to the Fundación Alternativa team for supporting him.

loans.use: to make some improvements to his kiosk and to buy more utensils.  He'll help his parents with the expenses with his income.

loans.name: Kyamasongi Twemanyiire Group

texts.en: Gertrude is a 49-year-old married mother of four children living in Fort Portal Uganda. She is a member of Kyamasongi Twemanyiire where each member guarantees the other will repay the loan. She is a retailer and at the same time a farmer. She is challenged by bad weather, especially heavy rainfall that affects her home and businesses, such as price fluctuation of her retail stock. However, she hopes to build a permanent house. Gertrude needs a loan to reinvest in her retail business by buying sugar, cooking oil, soap and omo (detergent) to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, soap and omo (detergent) to sell.

loans.name: Nyantwire Farmers' Group

texts.en:
Grace is a member of Nyantwire Farmers' Group, where each member guarantees the other to acquire a loan. Grace is aged 38, has 5 children, and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

Grace is a farmer growing food crops like matooke, pepper, and tomatoes, among other crops. She started this business with the hope of increasing her income so she can look after her family well. Grace faces the challenges of both limited capital and unpredictable changes in weather. Nevertheless, she hopes to educate all of her children to higher levels of learning. 

Grace requires a loan to improve her business and to buy tomato seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds for planting and to improve her business.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 43 years old. She is married and has seven children aged between 6 and 22 years.  All of them go to school. She has a shop where she sells saucepans and has been in business for eight years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more saucepans and buckets for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more saucepans and buckets for sale.

loans.name: Halima Juma

texts.en:
Halima is 32 years old and lives in Bagamoyo District, Tanzania with her husband and child. Halima volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching students life skills to boost their attendance and aptitude for learning in school. 

She currently does not have a business but she aspires to start a grocery business. She is requesting a Kiva loan to start her grocery business near her community and plans to use the profits to expand her business by buying products in bulk, and paying household expenses for her family.

loans.use: to start her grocery business near her community.

loans.name: Ziada L.

texts.en:
Ziada is 19 years old and lives in Bagamoyo District, Tanzania with her parents. She is a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches life skills to students at her nearby secondary school to boost their attendance and learning skills. 

Ziada doesn’t have a business yet, but she is requesting a Kiva loan to start a women’s clothing business. She plans to use her profits from the loan to expand her business and further her education through college courses.

loans.use: to start a women’s clothing business.

loans.name: Aneeta

texts.en:
Aneeta is 39 years old and married. She is the mother of 3 children.  

She has been in the business of manufacturing shoe boxes for many years. She has tremendous skill in doing it and has become famous in her community, catering to a large number of customers. She makes enough profit to provide for her family.

In order to expand her business, Aneeta contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase hard boards, cardboard, glue, scissors and cutters in large quantities to increase her sales. This will give a boost to her net income.

Aneeta wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to purchase hard boards, cardboard, glue, scissors and cutters in large quantities to increase her sales in order to get a boost in her net income.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en: Pili is 22 years old. She is married and lives with her mother in Kibaha district. Pili is a Camfed learner guide who volunteers to teach students life skills in a secondary school. Currently, she doesn't have a business. She is requesting a Kiva loan to start a women's clothing business. Pili will use the profit she will earn to purchase more products in bulk, as well as help her family with household expenses.

loans.use: to start a women's clothing business.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is 48, married, and the mother of 2 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. 

She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business.

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo in order to increase her sales and earn more profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo in order to increase her milk sales and earn more profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Pili M

texts.en:
Pili is 19 years old and lives in the Bagamoyo district with her mother. She is not married. She is a Camfed learner guide who teaches life skills to students in her nearby secondary school. 

Currently she doesn’t have a business, but she aspires to start a business of selling women's clothing. Pili is requesting a Kiva loan to start her women's clothing business. She plans to use her obtained profit to pay household expenses for herself and her mother.

loans.use: to start her women's clothing business.

loans.name: Aluwa

texts.en:
Aluwa is 21 years old. She is married with one child, and lives in the Kilolo district with her family and one sibling. 

Aluwa is a Camfed Learner Guide, helping students learning to boost their performance. She has a clothing business where she sells both men's and women's clothes. 

Aluwa is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing the variety of clothing designs, both for men and women. She plans to use the profit she will obtain from this business to establish a cattle business.

loans.use: to expand her clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by increasing the products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a business of selling women's clothes

loans.name: Clementina T

texts.en:
Clementina is 18 years old and lives with her parents in the Bagamoyo district. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at her local secondary school where she teaches life skills to students. Clementina is helping her parents with household tasks and farming. 

She requested a Kiva loan to start her own business of selling women's clothes. Clementina believes that this Kiva loan will change her status. Clementina plans to use the profit she will earn from the loan to rent a space to set up a shop for selling the clothes and to support her parents with the household expenses.

loans.use: to start her own business of selling women's clothes.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa, aged 21 years old, lives in Kibaha district with her grandmother. She is not married. She is a Camfed learner guide who volunteers to teach secondary students in the local secondary school about life skills. 

Sharifa doesn’t have a business now but plans to start a new business selling clothing near her community, and so she has requested a Kiva loan. 

She will use the profit to expand her business and help her grandmother to cover household expenses.

loans.use: to start a business selling clothing near her community

loans.name: Chuki

texts.en:
Chuki is 22 years old and lives in Kibaha district with her parents. She is not married. She is a Camfed learner guide who volunteers to teach students life skills by helping them understand well, as they are in and out of school. 

Chuki doesn't have a business currently, but she has requested a Kiva loan to start a business selling detergents (soap) near her village. She plans to use the profit generated through the loan to increase the products in her business and to pay household expenses for her parents.

loans.use: to start a business selling detergents (soap) near her village

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a 46-year-old married Palestinian mother of three children. She is acquiring this loan to pay for her children's school tuition fees. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Hiyam hopes to stay capable of providing her children with the necessary living needs, and developing their social situation.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 43-year-old single woman who two years ago started selling clothes to cover the needs and expenses of her family that consists of three members.
Salam is an ambitious lady who has a good reputation among her customers. She is trying hard to develop her business, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner AL Majmoua to increase her business merchandise.
