She wants to buy a new collection of winter clothes to satisfy her customers' needs, especially during the Christmas season. Salam hopes to open another branch to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es: José de 47 años de edad habita junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de 17, 12 y 9 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 8 años. Él es un hombre tenaz que se gana la vida con su trabajo de albañil independiente en una empresa de construcción. José desea continuar con la construcción de un tapial que tiene inconcluso por la falta de liquidez económica, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, grava, arena, cemento y hierro para terminar de construir un tapial en su vivienda.
texts.en: José is 47 years old and has lived in his own house for eight years with his partner and three children, aged 17, 12 and 9. He is a strong man who earns his living with his work as an independent bricklayer in a construction company. José wants to continue constructing a rammed earth wall that remains unfinished due to a lack of financial liquidity. So he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: bricks, gravel, sand, cement and iron to finish building this wall in his home.

loans.use: to invest in: bricks, gravel, sand, cement and iron to finish building a rammed earth wall in his home.

loans.name: Marbella Group

texts.es: Marbella lo integran tres microempresarios emprendedores, coordinado por la señora Marbella quien tiene la edad de 43 años, casada, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos en su domicilio desde hace dos años, solicita el crédito para la compra de productos como es cremas corporales, cremas para manos, tratamiento para el cabello, perfumes para damas y caballeros, colonias para niños, pinturas labiales, pinturas de uñas, etc. Otro de los socios es el señor Francisco quien tiene la edad de 52 años propietario de una pulpería en su domicilio, y la señora Alejandra de su negocio se basa en la hecha y venta de tortillas y nacatamales. Es el tercer ciclo que estos socios solicitan el financiamiento para sus negocios con el fin de crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Marbella is part of this group that includes three enterprising small entrepreneurs. She is also the group coordinator. Marbella is 43 years old, married, and has a business of selling cosmetics from her home. She has been in business for two years. Marbella is requesting a loan in order to buy products such as body crèmes, hand crèmes, hair treatments, perfumes for women and men, children’s colognes, lipsticks, nail polishes, and other items.

The other members are as follows:
• Sr. Francisco is 52 years old and the owner of a grocery store in his home.
• Sra. Alejandra has a business of producing and selling tortillas and Nicaraguan tamales.

The members are participating in their third loan cycle and will use the money that they requested to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy body crèmes, hand crèmes, hair treatments, perfumes for women and men, children’s colognes, lipsticks, nail polishes, and other items.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a 42 year-old single lady.  She sells beauty products and clothes and has been in the business for the past five years.
She supports a family of four. This is her first loan cycle, and she plans to expand her business by buying more stock with the profits she will make.

Her future hope is to expand her business and be able to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and clothes for sale.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 33-year-old married man with three children. He is a farmer and also a property broker, a business he has been running for the past seven years. This is his third loan cycle, the profits from which he plans to use to buy properties to sell. His future hope is to improve the living standards of his family and be able to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy properties to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Tucked away in the countryside near the Kimoning, Eldoret area of Kenya is a jobless mom and farmer named Susan, and her family of three lovely children. She is a hardworking mom and aggressive with the principle of truth on her lips.  She is honest and faithful to what she does and what she says.

Kimoning is a valley. In this valley are a people who, in their totality, constitute wrenching statistics. Hardcore poverty pervades every homestead.  Yet every day when you look beyond the numbers, you will see a sea of about 1,000 bright, vibrant, open faces, searching and yearning for the opportunity to live a life of dignity and respect. They have the conviction that it’s possible. Armed with this conviction, Susan has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. 

Susan is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little, irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Susan. Through a group of 10 members called Kopsirita, Susan has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Susan because the institution believes that women, too, are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Magret used the previous loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell. She is a 38-year-old married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children up to the university level. 

Magret has been operating a retail shop for the last 13 years, after saving the wages she earned as a housekeeper. She is facing hardships because not all of her customers pay on time. However, she has a vision of expanding her business to new areas. Magret needs a loan to buy general merchandise such as sodas,sugar, shoes, juices and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sodas,sugar, shoes, juices and salt to sell.

loans.name: Kibasi Tweyimukye Group

texts.en: Clovice is a member of the Kibasi Tweyimukye group where each member guarantees the other. He is aged 31 with four children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a retailer, and at the same time constructs houses which gives him more income. He faces the challenge of customers whom he gives his services on credit but then delay to pay him. However, he has hopes of diversifying into the transport business. Clovice needs a loan to buy sugar, rice, soap, beer, soda and cosmetics for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap, beer, soda and cosmetics for selling.

loans.name: Promise Land Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Sarah, a member of Promise Land Self Help Group in Nakuru Kenya. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in February 2013.
Sarah does maize and bean farming and also keeps dairy cows, selling the milk.  She is grateful to HiH EA for promoting a culture of saving, developing business skills and managing money prudently through training. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as seed and fertilizer for the upcoming planting season. She hopes this will lead to better crop yields and higher income sufficient to meet her family's needs such as food and education for her children.
Sarah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay this loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer that will help improve the crop yield.

loans.name: Kiletien Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Hellen, a member of Kiletien Women Group. She is 37 years old and a mother of three. Her economic activity is maize and bean farming. Hellen is grateful for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training that has enabled her to manage her business effectively. 
She is borrowing from Kiva to purchase farm inputs such as pesticides and manure. She believes this will boost her business and enable her to increase her income. She will therefore support her family with ease. 
Hellen is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as pesticides and manure that will help improve the crop yield.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock her gengeduka, or small grocery shop.

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr:
Ablaye est un client ancien de l’IMCEC qui s’active dans le commerce depuis 2003. Il a toujours pris appui chez cette dernière, et le revoilà pour son dixième crédit. Ce crédit qui lui servira à acheter une nouvelle cantine pour développer son activité de vente de radio, téléphones portables et accessoires. Il commence sa journée à 7h du matin et la termine à 22h et est aidé par son frère qui reste à la boutique avec lui ou seule quand il est absent. 
Ablaye est marié et père de quatre enfants dont l’ainé, un garçon de 13 ans et le cadet, 2ans. Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne et de la scolarité de ses enfants.
Les crédits pris à l’IMCEC l’ont beaucoup aidé : il a achevé la construction de sa maison, acheter sa cantine en 2006 et à beaucoup contribué à améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
Il souhaite toujours améliorer son activité car il ne connait que le commerce.
texts.en:
Ablaye, a long-time client of IMCEC, has been engaged in commerce since 2003. He has consistently relied on the support of the MFI, and he is now in his 10th loan cycle. This credit will allow him to buy a new place to sell radios, cell phones and accessories. He works from 7 a.m. until 10 p.m. with the assistance of his brother who works at the store with him and runs it when Ablaye is absent. 

Ablaye is married with four children; the eldest is a boy age 13, and the youngest is 2 years old. He is responsible for the daily expenses and for the children’s tuition. 

The credits granted by IMCEC were a big help; they allowed him to finish building his house, to buy a store in 2006, and to better feed his family. 

He plans to continue to improve his activity, as commerce is all he knows.

loans.use: to buy a new place to expand his radios, cell phones and accessories business

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 35-year-old married mother of three children. She is acquiring this loan to pay for her children's school tuition fees. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's 'Back to School' program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Siham hopes to remain capable of providing her children with their necessary living needs, and developing their social situation.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Gerber Vladimir

texts.es: Gerber tiene 37 años de edad y 4 de vivir en su casa propia al lado de su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos. Él hace 13 años aprendió el oficio de electricista gracias al cual logra sostener a su familia, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con este apoyo, al igual que con el apoyo de su compañera de vida que le aporta para los gastos de su hogar. Gerber desea construir una cisterna para reservar agua potable ya que desea tener una reserva de este vital líquido para el uso de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una cisterna en su vivienda.
texts.en: Gerber is 37 years old. For 4 years he has lived in his house alongside his life partner and their 2 children. For 13 years he learned the trade of electrician, thanks to which he manages to support his family, so he is happy to be able to count on this support which is equal to the support of his life partner who helps him with the house expenses. Gerber wants to build a cistern to have a potable (drinkable) water reserve since he wants to have a reserve of this vital liquid for use in his home. For this he is requesting a FUSAI loan to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a cistern in his house.

loans.use: To invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a cistern in his house.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatima is a 41-year-old Lebanese married woman living with three kids and her husband, who repairs water canals.

Five years ago, she started to produce bread from her home in order to provide her family with extra financial support. And today, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase raw materials, such as flour, oil, etc., with the aim of augmenting her production and thus her profits.

Fatima is willing to open a bakery soon, and she confirms that by requesting more Kiva loans, she will be able to achieve her objective.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as flour, oil, etc.

loans.name: Santander Enrique

texts.es: Santander, reside en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, este hombre de 37 años de edad, es comerciante desde el año 2006, inició vendiendo aguacates al por mayor y cuando se casó necesitaba más ingresos para su familia,  por lo que le empezó a ofrecer calzado, jeans y perfumes a sus amigos y conocidos.  Él es padre de un hijo de siete años a quien desea brindarle la mejor educación académica para que su hijo tenga un futuro promisorio, su familia es su principal motivación para continuar trabajando con compromiso y dedicación.  Sus compras las realiza de contado en Maicao es una ciudad ubicada en el Departamento de La Guajira y en almacenes de la capital de Colombia. El ofrece facilidad de pago a sus clientes con quienes pacta las fechas para realizar los cobros, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual surtirá su negocio con juguetes para la navidad, nuevos modelos de jeans, camisetas, suéteres y calzado, para aprovechar las fiestas en la que nos encontramos en los días de navidad. Su meta de negocio es hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar las ventas.
texts.en: Santander lives in a neighbourhood of the municipality of Barranquilla. He is a 37-year-old man who has been a shopkeeper since 2006. He began selling avocados wholesale and when he married he needed more income for his family, so he began offering shoes, jeans, and perfumes to his friends and acquaintances. He is a father of a seven-year-old son and wants to provide the best academic education so his son can have a promising future. Santander's family is his principal motivation to keep working with commitment and dedication. His purchases are made in cash in Maicao (a city located in the Department of La Guajira) and in stores in the capital of Colombia. He offers ease of payment to his clients, who agree on when their payments are due. Currently he is applying for a Kiva loan, first acquiring funding through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan he will stock his store with new models of Christmas toys, jeans, shirts, sweaters and shoes, to make the most of the parties we encounter during the holidays. His business goal is to grow his business and increase sales.

loans.use: To stock his business with new models of Christmas toys, jeans, shirts, sweaters, and shoes

loans.name: Jessica Paola

texts.es:
Jessica joven ecuatoriana nació en la ciudad de Latacunga tiene 21 años de edad actualmente se encuentra casada y tienen una hija pequeña de 2 años, es oriunda de la ciudad de Latacunga y  vive en casa de  los padres, gracias al sacrificio y esfuerzo de ellos Jessica pudo terminar sus estudios secundarios, y por la necesidad hoy en día se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, este negocio lo aprendió desde muy chica a sus padres y familiares, ya que la mayoría se dedica a esta actividad, vive un una zona rural de la ciudad, sector muy conocido por la agricultura y crianza de animales menores, las ventas que realiza son en forma ambulante dentro y fuera de la ciudad.
Jessica es un gran apoyo para su esposo y ha sido quien ha sacado adelante su hogar ya sea en su negocio y cuidando de su pequeña hija y es así como ella tiene que sustentar sus necesidades y ser un apoyo para su familia, su pequeño negocio ha ido creciendo cada vez más.  
Hoy está solicitando un segundo crédito, el m ismo que lo utilizará para la compra de más cerdos que va a traer de la ciudad de Ambato.
Ella agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Jessica is a young Ecuadoran.  She was born in Latacunga and is 21-years old.  She is currently married and has one young daughter, who is 2-years old.  She is a native of Latacunga and lives in her parents' house.  Thanks to her parents' hard work and sacrifices, Jessica was able to finish secondary school.  Nowadays, out of necessity, she makes her living raising and selling pigs.  She learned the business as a young girl from her parents and family members, as the majority of them make their livings in this line of work.  Jessica lives in a rural area of the city, in a sector well-known for agriculture and raising small animals.  Jessica travels around the city and outside the city to make her sales. 
Jessica is a great help to her husband and has been the one to get their household ahead, both in their business and in taking care of their small daughter.  She provides for their needs and is a support for their family.  Her little one has been growing more and more each day. 
Today Jessica is requesting her second loan.  She will use the loan to purchase more pigs from the city of Ambato.
Jessica is grateful for Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and for Kiva for making it possible for her to grow personally and professionally.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs so she can help her husband and get her young daughter ahead.

loans.name: Magaji Yauma

texts.en: Magaji Yauma is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Magaji Yauma joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children. Before becoming a Babban Gona member, Magaji Yauma would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Magaji Yauma can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Magaji Yauma spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thus reducing pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, a small-holder farmer who specializes in horticulture, is based in a small village called Kamagut, near Eldoret, Kenya. This mother of four has been involved in agriculture on her small, fertile piece of land for 16 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops and personal businesses. 

Elizabeth is seeking a loan to expand her maize farm. Her biggest challenge over the years as a farmer has been lack of adequate capital. It is very hard for small-holder farmers to save enough capital for expansion since farming is marred with all sorts of external risks such as climatic conditions, pests and diseases, political instability, fluctuation of prices and high costs of inputs. Because of these factors, the sure way farmers can obtain adequate capital is through leveraging their businesses. 

With your loan investment, Elizabeth is going to expand her farm in order to increase its output. If and when the investment pays off, Elizabeth will plough the profits back into the farm and increase her asset base.

loans.use: To expand her maize farm

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a 39-year-old married lady with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer growing food crops like maize and bananas and at the same time she has a tailoring service which she does to add extra income. She faces challenges of limited capital, though she has hopes of educating all her children to higher levels of learning. 

Annet has asked for a loan to rent a Kisubi (banana) plantation to harvest and sell.

loans.use: to rent a banana plantation to harvest and sell.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert lives in a rural area with his family. He is 35 years old and does agricultural production and trading. He is taking a loan of 800,000 UGX to help him buy beans and coffee during this time when the prices are low. He will sell them later at a higher value to make profit. 

Herbert has dreams of constructing a permanent house for his family before bearing many children. His challenge is that he didn’t get a chance to attend school and he wants to see all his children study to compensate the loss.

loans.use: to buy beans and coffee.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en: Manana is 59 years old. She lives in the Batumi district with her 21-year-old son, Kakha. Manana is a babysitter and gets a monthly salary. Kakha works as a security. Manana owns a flat and wants to rent it out for additional income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 3,000 USD. With the received credit she will renovate the flat and rent it out. This will increase her income and with increased income she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out in order to generate additional income.

loans.name: Arley Fred

texts.es:
A sus 40 años de edad, Arley se encontraba desesperado en su hogar pues no tenía un empleo, buscaba y no encontraba, mientras pasaban los días se iba agotando el alimento y él sin dinero para salir a comprar.
Afectado por esta situación Arley con determinación tomo la decisión de iniciar su propio negocio de venta de pollos, y aprovechando una zona verde que tiene en su hogar desea solicitar un crédito para iniciar con el negocio que ha planeado, invirtiendo el capital en madera para construir un criadero de pollos y comprar los animales para el engorde.
Esta actividad podría mantener ocupado a Arley, generando los recursos para mantener a su familia y porque no consolidarse a un periodo de 5 años como uno de los criadores de pollos más importantes del sector
texts.en:
At the age of 40, Arley felt hopeless because he did not have a job; he looked for one but could not find one. The days passed and the food was running out, and he was without money to go buy it.
He was affected by this situation, so with determination he decided to start his own business selling chickens. He would take advantage of a green space in his home. He wants to request a loan to start the business he has planned. He will invest capital in wood to build a chicken coop and buy animals to fatten.
This work will keep Arley occupied, generate an income to care for his family, and maybe even in five years allow him to become one of the most important chicken farmers in the region.

loans.use: to start his business selling chickens by buying chickens and hens.

loans.name: Chingamudzi Group

texts.en: Edina is 50 years old and married with five children. She sells second-hand clothes to people in her community. The profits she makes from her business helps her to pay school fees for her children and to reduce the level of poverty in her household. She will use the loan to boost up her business. Her main goal is to improve her family’s living standards and build them a good house. She dreams of sending her children to better schools. Accessing loans have helped Edina to at least have enough food in her household and provide her children with school materials.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Kulwa

texts.en:
Kulwa is 31 years old. She is married, has two children and lives in the Bagamoyo district. Kulwa is a Camfed leaner guide who volunteers in her nearby secondary school, teaching life skills. 

She requested a Kiva loan to start a business of selling children's clothes near her community. She will use the obtained profit to pay household expenses for her family and to purchase more products for her shop.

loans.use: to start a business of selling children's clothes near her community.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 20-year-old single man from a village near Nablus city. His father works in transferring goods using his car, where he earns a low income. Khaled is a university student specialized in business administration. He would like to take the BA degree and find a job in the future.

Khaled took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Khaled will be able to complete his study pay part of the urgent expenses he has.

Khaled appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Valientes, es un grupo conformada por 17 mujeres realmente valientes que se esmeran día a día por salir adelante a través del trabajo digno y cooperativo, se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, con muchas ansias de aprender y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Diana es integrante de este comité, se la caracteriza por su laboriosidad y gran espíritu emprendedor, es joven y muy activa, se desempeña como peluquera, es muy eficiente en su trabajo lo cual es motivo de su éxito laboral. El préstamo lo pide para poder ampliar su salón de belleza y en la compra de productos varios para poder asistir a sus clientes.
Todas las integrantes se sienten muy agradecidas por la ayuda y asesoramiento que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The loan committee Mujeres Valientes [Strong Women] is a group comprised of 17 really strong women who strive daily to get ahead through honest and collaborative work. They are in their first cycle in the Committee of Women Program with many eager to learn and improve their living conditions.

Diana is a member of this committee. She is characterized by her hard work and entrepreneurial spirit. She is young and very active. She works as a hairdresser and is very efficient in her work which is the reason for her success in that job. She requests a loan to expand her salon and purchase several products to attend to her clients.

All members are very grateful for the help and advice they are receiving.

loans.use: to expand her beauty salon

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es: Teresa tiene 24 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 4 y 1 años de edad. Ella se gana la vida desde hace 6 años con su negocio de un ciber café en el cual alquila computadoras y apoya a buscar información en internet, dicho negocio se encuentra instalado en su vivienda, lo que le permite estar pendiente de sus hijos. Teresa desea reparar el techo de su corredor ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado y es en ese lugar donde tiene instalado su negocio, por lo que teme que en época lluviosa pueda deteriorar las computadoras, y para ello solicita un  crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, tornillos, polines y mano de obra para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Teresa is 24 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children who are 4 and 1 years of age.  

For 6 years she has earned a living with her cyber cafe business in which she rents computers and helps look for information on the internet.  This business is carried out in her home which allows her to keep an eye on her children. 

Teresa wishes to repair the roof of the open-sided veranda that runs the length of the side of the house since it is currently deteriorated and it is in this place where her business is installed. 

She is afraid that during the rainy season it can damage the computers and thus she is asking for a loan with FUSAI to invest in sheet metal, screws, poles and labour to change the roof on her home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, screws, poles and labour to change the roof on her home

loans.name: Dúo Genesis 2 Group

texts.es:
DUO GENESIS 2 
El cual esta integrado por la señora ELVIA quien es propietaria de  una venta de tortillas y madre de 4 hijos la señora ELVIA ha logrado obtener bastante ganancia atraves del ultimo crédito que se le otorgo y  espera en DIOS poder seguir trabajando con la institución pues le gustan los benéficos que se le da  y esto lo hace ella para poder cumplir y llevar a cabo cada una de las metas y sueños que tiene para su familia y es por ello que nuevamente toca las puertas de FAPE para la adquisición de un nuevo crédito esperando que le tome en cuenta dicha solicitud, esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de maiz para la elaboracion de tortillas.
texts.en:
Genesis 2 Group

Sra. Elvia is a member of this group. She is the owner of a tortilla shop and the mother of four children. With the last loan that she received, Sra. Elvia was able to generate enough profit. She trusts in God that she can continue working with FAPE because she enjoys the benefits that have been given to her. Elvia hopes to fulfill and carry out each of the goals and dreams that she has set for her family.

Once again, Elvia has come through the doors of FAPE in order to acquire another loan. She is waiting for an answer to her request. Elvia is requesting this loan so that she can buy corn for making tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn for making tortillas.

loans.name: Dúo Lluvias De Gracias De Barcenas Group

texts.es:
Duo lluvias de Gracia de Barcenas
Karina es madre soltera tiene 29 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa americana inicio hace 5 años vende en el mercado de su comunidad, renta un local para poder vender su ropa sueña con tener un lugar propio para asi no pagar renta y que esa ganancia sea para ella, y asi poder brindarle todo lo necesario a su hija. Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa se seguna mano(ropa Americana)espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
The group "Duo Lluvias de Gracia de Barcenas": 

Karina is a single mother of 29 years. She works selling American clothing. She started doing this 5 years ago. She sells in the market of her community, where she rents a stall in order to be able to sell her clothing. Her dream ist so have her own stall, so that she does not have to pay rent and can keep this money for herself. By this, she would be able to provide her daughter with everything she needs.

She asks for this loan to buy second hand clothing (American clothing) and hopes that you will help her with the loan she asks for.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing for selling (American clothing).

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is a 55-year-old divorced woman. She lives with her daughter and pensioner mother in Telavi district, Kakheti region. Natela is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she cultivates a plot of land and grows maize, which she sells seasonally.

Natela wants to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,000 Gel. With the received credit, she will purchase clothes to begin a trade along with the agricultural activities.

Natela awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin a trading business along with the agricultural activities.

loans.name: Luchadores De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Luchadores de San Pedro El encargado de este grupo es el joven Héctor quien tiene su venta de maíz por libra y quintal, jabón por unidad y por caja y venta de huevos por cartón desde hace varios años la cual está ubicado en el primer nivel de un mercado.  Las fechas de venta están muy cerca y  las personas que son clientes están pidiendo bastante  maíz por quintales valorados en Q. 135.00 cada uno.  Quiere comprar varios quintales en estas fechas que aun no han aumentado los precios del maíz por quintal, y así vender a buen precio días después donde el maíz sube obteniendo bonitas ganancias.  El dinero que tiene no le alcanza y no quiere desaprovechar las ofertas de maíz por quintal que se le presentan, por tal motivo necesita un préstamo para comprar y no quedarles mal a las personas que ya confían en su persona y que no les ha quedado mal al momento de pedir sus quintales de maíz a buen precio.
texts.en:
Héctor's in charge of Luchadores de San Pedro Group.  For several years he has sold corn by the pound and the quintal, soap by the box and individually, and eggs by the carton.  He's located on the first floor of a market.

The sales dates are coming up and his customers are requesting a lot of corn by the quintal, valued at 135 GTQ/quintal.  He wants to buy several quintals of corn now, when the prices per quintal haven't gone up yet, so he can sell at a good price later when the prices do go up, thus earning a nice profit.

Héctor doesn't have enough money and he doesn't want to miss the sale price of corn by the quintal.  That's why he needs a loan--for the purchase and so he won't look bad to the people who trust him when they order their quintals of corn at a good price.

loans.use: to buy corn to sell

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Agricultural production is very important to the economy of developing nations, including Kenya. It is the major occupation of the inhabitants, providing employment directly or indirectly for at least 75% of the people. This writing draws your attention to Anne, who relies on the dairy cow and poultry she keeps to make a living. Anne is a hardworking and committed mother who is a smallholder farmer in Eldoret. She has been practicing dairy farming for six years now. She also keeps poultry and grows vegetables for subsistence. 

Anne passionately loves dairy farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is feeding her cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. She is seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter. The chaff cutter will assist Anne in cutting hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forage to feed her cow. Also, it will aid the animal’s digestion and prevent the animals from rejecting any part of their food. 

Before Anne joined Juhudi Kilimo, a Kenyan microfinance institution supporting smallholder farmers with technical and financial solutions. She considered dairy farming to be a mediocre fallback occupation that did not have a future promise for income generation. After training, she now believes that dairy farming is the business to go into if you want a rather less rough way into the “millionaires club”. An increase in income will allow Anne to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Her dream is to continue improving her dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards. Anne fears that her dreams might not be realized if Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders cease to provide the reliable market channel, credit facility and services that she requires to grow her dairy enterprise.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Jhon David

texts.es:
Jhon es un hombre muy trabajador y organizado, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de personas e su motocicleta a través de las veredas del municipio de Támesis posibilitando el desplazamiento de la comunidad hasta las distintitas áreas del municipio.

Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, es soltero y sostiene a su madre a la cual siempre ha procurado ofrecerle la mejor vida posible.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de una nueva moto ya que esta es su único medio de trabajo y desea poder mejorar su servicio.

Con este crédito podrá continuar prestando su servicio con total seguridad y sin poner en riesgo su vida ni la de sus clientes con un moto vieja

Apoya a Jhon con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Jhon is a very hard-working and organized man. He earns a living providing transportation services to people on his motorcycle through the streets of Tamesis municipality as well as to distinct areas of the municipality. He is a friendly man, helpful, and very enterprising. He is single and supports his mother for whom he is always striving to make a better life possible.

He seeks a loan to buy a new motorcycle as it is his only mode for work and he wishes to improve his service. With this loan he will be able to continue offering his service with total safety and without being able to put his life or the life of his customers at risk with an old motorcycle.

Support Jhon with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Juan Jesus

texts.es:
Juan Jesus tiene 38 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente. Reside en casa propia, él es natural de la zona. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila ya que su actividad es la agricultura, ganadería, comercio y transporte. Su comunidad esta ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropon, región Pirua, costa norte de Perú.

Juan Jesus se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral (pollos, gallos, pavos), esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 2 años, es conocido por sus vecinos y cuenta con muy buenas referencias perosnales, laborales y económicas en la zona donde vive. El destino del crédito será para mejorar su corral(lugar donde cría a sus animales). El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido al crecimiento económico de la zona. Con el mejora de sus corrales Juan Jesus podrá mejorar la calidad de crianza de sus animales y asi poder venderlos a un mejor precio, además de captar nuevos clientes, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Jesus is 38 and in a relationship. He lives in his own home in his hometown. The community life is peaceful, since the community works in agriculture, livestock, commerce and transportation. The community is located in the Morropon district and province, in the Pirua region, on the northern coast of Peru.
Juan Jesus raises barnyard birds (chickens, roosters, and ducks). He has been doing this for two years. He is known by his neighbours and has very good personal, work, and economic references from his area. 
He will use the loan to improve his chicken coops. The market is good at the moment because of the economic growth of the area. Through improving his coops, Juan will be able to improve the quality of his birds and be able to sell them at a greater price. He will also be able to capture new clients, which will allow him to increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to improve the chicken coop.

loans.name: Alvaro Leon

texts.es:
Álvaro, un hombre soltero de 53 años de edad, no tiene hijos su único y gran amor es su restaurante a cual él quiere dedicar cuerpo y alma para sacarlo adelante. 
Su mayor prioridad en su negocio es lograr una estabilidad y cierto grado de reconocimiento entre las personas, que coman y vuelvan a comer en su restaurante y como está inmerso en el mundo de los alimentos sabe que la primera impresión es la visual y en eso falla por ello quiere solicitar un cerdito, el cual invertirá en adecuaciones locativas, cuadros, pinturas, silletería, el resto del dinero será invertido en insumos para la preparaciones de la comida típica antioqueña como bandeja paisa, sancocho o calentado.
texts.en:
Álvaro, a 53-year-old unmarried man, does not have children and his only and greatest love is his restaurant to which he wants to dedicate his body and soul in order to get it off the ground.

His main priority in his business is to achieve stability and certain degree of recognition among people, who eat and come back to eat in his restaurant. Because he is immersed in the world of food, he knows that the first impression is visual, and in that area he is lacking. For that reason, he wants to ask for a loan which he will invest in renovations, paintings, paint, sets of chairs, and the rest of the money will be invested in supplies to make typical Antioquian [from Antioquia, Colombia] foods like bandeja paisa, sancocho, or calentado.

loans.use: To make renovations, buy paintings, paint, sets of chairs, and supplies to make traditional Antioquian foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first prepay microgrid

loans.name: Señor Del Calvario De Huariquiña Group

texts.es: El grupo “SEÑOR DEL CALVARIO DE HUARIQUIÑA” está conformado por socios dedicados al comercio minorista y a prestar servicios. Merly tiene 36 años de edad es soltera con un hijo dependiente. Ella implemento su peluquería hace un año en su vivienda. En el cual ofrece cortes de cabello para damas caballeros y niños tintes y ondulaciones. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una secadora y plancha de cabello  para mejorar la atención a sus clientes. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Merly es la segunda persona parada del lado izquierdo  viste pashmina azul.
texts.en: The “SEÑOR DEL CALVARIO DE HUARIQUIÑA” group is made up of members who operate small retail businesses and provide services. Merly Is 36 years old, single and has a dependent child. She started her hair salon in her home a year ago. There she offers haircuts for women, men and children, hair coloring and perms. She will use the loan to purchase a hairdryer and hair iron so that she can improve service for her customers. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan provided. Merly is the second person standing on the left and is wearing a blue sweater.

loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer and hair iron.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, sand, bricks, zinc, ceramic, Durox layers, glass layers, shores, dry wall and "bondex".

loans.name: Ana Zonia

texts.es: Ana tiene 40 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos 2 varones de 15 y 12 años y una niña de 8 años de edad. Ella se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de elaboración y venta de tortillas actividad que realiza desde hace  6 años en su vivienda, por lo que no le genera ningún gasto de local obteniendo mejores ingresos. Ana desea construir el baño y la pila de su vivienda, ya que sabe que son muy necesarios para mantener la sanidad de una vivienda, y es para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un baño y una pila en su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Ana is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her spouse and their 3 children: 2 boys of 15 and 12 years and a girl of 8 years. She makes a living through her business making and selling tortillas, an activity she has carried out for 6 years in her home. Therefore, it does not generate any local expenses, obtaining better income. Ana wants to build a bath and sink in her house, since she knows that these are very necessary to maintain the health of the home, and for which she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a bath and a sink in her home as soon as possible.

loans.use: To invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a bath and sink in her house.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
El señor Leónidas tiene 62 años de edad, vive con su esposa en una comunidad al oriente de Honduras,  su actividad es la venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar, también se dedica a la caficultura y ganadería contando con más de 5 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad.
Don Leónidas tiene una buena clientela porque su negocio está ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico está muy agradecido con Prisma ya que en su primer préstamo su pulpería ha crecido y ha sido de mucho provecho.
Don Leónidas está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra churros, frijoles, arroz, café, agua, pan, leche, huevos, aceite, etc. Para surtir mas su negocio y así satisfacer la demanda de su clientela,  lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Don Leónidas uno de sus sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida y su casa.

Trojes,  Honduras -  Noviembre 2014
texts.en:
Leónidas is 62 years old, he lives with his wife in a community of Eastern Honduras, and he engages in selling basic necessities; on top of this, he has also been engaging in coffee growing and livestock breeding for more than 5 years.
Leónidas has a good number of customers because his shop is located in a strategic area. He is deeply grateful to Prisma, as thanks to his first loan his general store has grown and he has increased his earnings.
Leónidas is requesting another loan to buy churros, beans, rice, coffee, water, bread, milk, eggs and oil in order to stock up his shop and to meet his customers’ requests. This will help him increase his earnings to pay for his family’s expenses and to extinguish his debts.
One of Leónidas’ dreams is to improve the living conditions in his house.

Trojes, Honduras – November 2014

loans.use: To buy churros, beans, rice, coffee, water, bread, milk, eggs and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, shortening, margarine, leavening, and eggs for her business

loans.name: Goret

texts.en: Goretti used the previous loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is agriculture alongside running a bar for additional income. She faces challenges of price fluctuation, pests and customers who do not pay on time. She has a vision of expanding her business to more areas and venturing into modern farming methods. Goretti intends to use the loan to stock her maize harvest to sell it later on, at higher prices.

loans.use: to stock her maize harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Aimable

texts.en:
Aimable is 30 years old. He is not married. He sells clothes and has been in a business for five years. 

With the loan requested, Aimable would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 33 years old. He is married with seven children aged between the ages of one and fourteen years. Four of them go to school. 

Joseph sells shoes and has been working in business for seven years. With the loan requested, he would like to buy more shoes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Ermita Cecilia

texts.es:
Ermita es una mujer ecuatoriana de 41 años de edad, vive en la parroquia Eloy Alfaro en un barrio urbano del sector perteneciente a la Provincia de Cotopaxi, está casada, tienen dos hijos, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la primaria, luego dejo de estudiar porque tuvo un nuevo reto en la vida y ese era el de cuidar a su hija, es de esta manera que ella empezó a trabajar desde muy chica para poder sustentar sus necesidades y del nuevo ser que ahora la compaña.
Para Ermita no fue nada fácil alejarse de sus padres ya que era la consentida del hogar, sufrió mucho pero sin embargo ella luchó para ser una buena madre y esposa y así poder darles lo mejor a sus hijos y no se dejó vencer por el dolor que sentía ella ahora es muy feliz porque Dios y la vida le dio la oportunidad de ver crecer a su hijios.
Actualmente Ermita y su familia viven en casa propia y se dedica a elaboración de artesanías desde hace varios años, a pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, ella dedica mucho tiempo también a los cuidados de sus pequeños hijos.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y hoy solicita un crédito que lo utilizará en la compra de cerámicas y activos fijos para mejorar su local, esto ayudará a mejorar sus estilo de vida y el de su familia, dándoles la educación que se merece.
Ermita agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Ermita is a 41 -year-old woman from Ecuador who lives in the parish of Eloy Alfaro in an urban area of the district belonging to the province of Cotopaxi. She is married and has two children. Thanks to the efforts of her parents, she managed to attend school as far as primary level, then she left her studies as she had the new challenge of looking after her daughter. This is how she came to start working from a young age to look after her young child.

It was not easy for Ermita to leave her parents, as she was the favourite at home. She suffered a great deal, but she struggled hard to be a good mother and wife and thus be able to provide the best she could for her children. She didn't allow the pain she felt to overcome her. Now she is very happy because God and life have given her the opportunity to see her children grow up.

Ermita and her family now live in their own home, and Ermita has been working making handicraft products for several years. In spite of having a job that demands a lot of effort and time, she always dedicates a lot of time to caring for her young children. She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman.

Today she is asking for a loan to buy ceramics and tools to improve her shop. This will help her improve her way of life and that of her family, and to be able to give her children the education they deserve. She is grateful to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making possible this growth in her personal and professional life.

loans.use: to buy ceramics and tools for her business so she can improve her own and her family's life.

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en:
Janvier is 37 years old. He is married with three children, aged between one and five years. They do not yet go to school. 

Janvier has a bar and he has been in business for three years. 

With the loan requested, Janvier would like to buy more sorghum to make local drinks to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to make local drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 46 years old. She is married with six children between the ages of 7 and 23 years. All of them go to school. 

Ruth has a shop and has been in a business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more lotions, saucepans and buckets for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more lotions, saucepans and buckets for sale.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is 44 years old. She is married with seven children aged between three and 18 years. Three of them go to school. She sells food stuffs and has been in this business for 10 years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.en:
Geronimo is a small Mexican farmer who owns cows and lives from selling their milk on the local market and to the dairy industry. He decided to invest in a biodigester to take advantage of the manure his cows produce in large quantities and use it to produce his own biogas and biofertilizer. This investment will allow him to reduce his important expenses in the fossil fuel based LP gas, and to increase the yield of his corn field in a natural way by spreading the nutrient-rich organic fertilizer on the field instead of the untreated and less productive manure. His operating costs will be reduced, while his environment will be cleaner and his productivity will improve. His cows' manure will not free greenhouse gases in the atmosphere anymore, nor contaminate underground water sources. Geronimo is pictured here a few days after his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester was installed. He already put the initial amount of manure in the system, which is about to produce biogas to cook and heat water in the house.

This loan represents 46% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Philadephia Group

texts.en: Grace is 31 years old, married with two children and she cares for five orphans. Since her family lives under the poverty line, she started obtaining loans in order to  alleviate her level of poverty. She sells second hand clothes to people in her community. She started this business in order to pay school fees for her children and their medical bills. She will use the loan to expand her business by buying more bales of second hand clothes.  She plans to improve her family’s living standards and hopes to build a better house for her children.  With the help of the loans she has obtained in previous years, she is now able to pay school fees for her children without any difficulties.

loans.use: Buy bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Moises

texts.en:
Moises is a medium-sized farmer. He owns several hundreds of cows and lives from selling their milk and meat. He also owns a few fields where he cultivates corn, oat and alfalfa to feed his cows. He decided to purchase a large Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to close the natural cycle on his farm. From now on, his cows' waste will be input in the biodigester to produce biogas to cook and heat the house, as well as nutrient-rich organic fertilizer that Moises will spread on his field to increase their yield in a natural way and improve the quality of his cows' forage. As an experienced farmer, Moises knows that the increasing cost of LP gas and chemical fertilizers can be burdensome. He wants to give his children and grandchildren a sustainable farm, which does not contaminate the environment and is self-sufficient.

This loan represents 35% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 40 m3 waste-to-energy system.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is a happily married 48-year-old man with three kids. He lives in a trading center a few kilometres from Ibanda town, popularly referred to as "kensi yoona", literally translated as world market because that's where many people converge in the evenings to eat and drink beer. He therefore did not go wrong in starting a bar and lodging in the same area because he is assured of market. This being a festive season the market is much higher. He has therefore applied for a loan to renovate his lodges to make them better habitable and appeasing to customers. His dream is to accumulate more money to set up good standard premises for his customers. He is hard working and focused and thanks UGAFODE for serving the rural poor.

loans.use: to  renovate the customer lodging.

loans.name: Warmi Group

texts.es:
ANGELA XIMENA del Pilar, tiene 19 años de edad, ella es socia del grupo de nombre "Warmi" que viene a ser una palabra quechua que significa mujer, éste grupo está formado por cinco socias jóvenes y emprendedoras.
Angela Ximena del Pilar, se dedica a la preparación y venta de alfajores, ella trabaja en su casa, bajo la modalidad de pedidos y luego los entrega a sus clientes. Es una actividad que le agrada mucho por lo que le dedica mucho tiempo y con las ganancias de su negocio puede juntar para iniciar sus estudios superiores. paralelamente a ésta actividad ella ofrece a la venta productos naturales y esto también le ayuda a formar e incrementar su capital.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los alfajores como harina, azúcar y otros los cuales podrá comprar en mayor cantidad para que le resulte más económico, asimismo adquirirá los materiales para hacer las cajitas en las cuales presenta y entrega sus alfajores.
texts.en:
Angela Ximena del Pilar is 19 years old, and she is a member of the group named “Warmi”, a Quechua Word meaning “woman”. The group is composed of 5 young and resourceful members.
Angela Ximena del Pilar engages on preparing and selling “alfajores” (sweet biscuits with fillings”. She works in her house, preparing orders she then delivers to her customers. It is an activity she likes a lot, and she dedicates a lot of time to this; thanks to her earnings she can save enough money to begin her higher education career. She also sells natural products, and this helps her as well in creating and increasing her earnings.
The loan she has requested will be invested in the purchase of ingredients to prepare alfajores such as flour and sugar. She will buy them in big quantities so that their price will be cheaper; she will also buy the materials she needs to prepare the small boxes she uses to display and distribute her alfajores.

loans.use: To buy four, sugar and materials to prepare the boxes to display and sell her alfajores.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Doña Francisca es madre de una joven universitaria y es jefa de hogar, tiene una soda de la cual depende su único ingreso familiar. Actualmente la ubica en un local muy pequeño y desea pasarla a un lugar más amplio. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡1.000.000) Este dinero lo utilizara para equipar dicho local, de esta manera pretende aumentar su clientela y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Francisca has a daughter who studies at the university. Francisca is the head of the household and has a café on which she depends, because it is the only source of income of her household.

At the moment, the café is on very small premises and she wants to move it to a bigger property. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 1 million CRC. She will use the money to set up the café on its new premises. By this, she will be able to attract more customers and to increase her economic resources.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her café.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy drinks for the grocery store and to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en:
Maria Cristina is pictured here on the day her biodigester was installed. She made the important decision to invest in her Sistema Biobolsa biodigester because she was interested in producing her own biogas and organic fertilizer. She owns several cows and cultivates alfalfa for their forage. Prior to owning the biodigester, she was buying expensive LP gas to cook and heat water in the house, as well as chemical fertilizers for her field. These were not only costly, but also unsustainable solutions which damaged her environment. From now on, Maria Cristina will use her cows' manure to produce methane-rich biogas as well as a nutrient-rich fertilizer she will spread on her fields to produce more and better quality forage for her cows. The cycle is closed, Maria Cristina will save money and live in a more comfortable environment, as the flies will not be attracted by the piles of waste anymore. With the savings she will make, Maria Cristina plans to improve her house.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 10 m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is an enterprising young man from Nyakacwamba, a rural area. He is 22 years old and owns a milling machine. This is because many of the villagers depend on posho and millet, so he has a ready market, The machine engine is however broken down and he does not have enough funds to buy the new engine. He thus approached our Ibanda branch for a loan so that he can buy a new engine that will increase his efficiency especially during this festive season. From this machine  he has managed to pay for his sister's tuition fee in a nursing school and also look after himself. He is hard working and looks toward a continued partnership. He thanks the lenders for the good job of alleviating poverty among the rural poor.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for the milling machine

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en: Susana is 55 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 12 and 31 years; 3 of them go to school. She sells food stuffs and has been running her business for 15 years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more beans for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more beans for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a Mexican farmer who has been looking for solutions to reduce her operational costs. Indeed, LP gas prices are increasing and she is also spending a considerable amount of her income on chemical fertilizers. By investing in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Veronica is shifting towards a more sustainable and more economic farming model, which allows her to transform her animals' manure into renewable energy and organic fertilizer. Her farm will produce everything she needs, reducing her dependency on external  supplies and improving the yield of her field by spreading the nutrient-rich fertilizer on her corn and oat. the biogas will be used to cook and heat water in the house. Veronica plans to use her savings to improve the stable and other installations for her animals, in order to be able to expand capacity.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase an 8 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.en: Gumercinda payed her first loan on time and now is asking for a new loan to stock of her grocery store.

loans.use: to stock up her grocery store, specifically with canned goods and dairy products.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is married and has a small child, she owns a small grocery store and is asking for a loan to buy merchandise and restock it. She says that her business is growing and has gained many new clients. She used to work in other people's stores and two years ago she gained the courage to open her own business. It is a small business but she is committed to making it grow.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and restock her grocery store.

loans.name: Claudia Yessica

texts.en: Claudia is 36 years old, she is married and has three small children. She lives in her parents' house and has worked in sales for more than 10 years. She started selling blankets and has diversified into other home products. She is asking for a loan to buy more blankets to sell in the cold weather season. Her biggest achievement is being able to buy furniture for her parents' house and providing some stability to her family.

loans.use: To buy blankets for door to door catalog sales.

loans.name: Juana Virginia

texts.en:
Juana is 57 years old and describes herself as a calm, sociable person that spends her free time doing handcrafts, reading and watching TV. 

Juana owns a grocery store that she opened 10 years ago. In the store she offers basic food products and snacks. The store is located in her house, and because of this she is able to open from Monday to Sunday. 

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to offer more product variety to her clients. She says that her biggest accomplishments are paying for her children's education and being able to travel to different places. Her goal is to consolidate and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries and offer more product variety.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy good quality seedlings and fertilizer that will boast her crop production

loans.name: Ireen

texts.en: Irene is a mother of three children, who are all going to school and living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She deals in secondhand clothes and does teaching and produce selling to supplement her income. Irene has a dream of building a house for her family despite the challenge of defaulters and the unpredictable weather changes. Irene intends to use the loan to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is aged fifty two, with two children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He carries out cattle fattening together with farming, a business he started with an aim of income generation. He is working hard to maintain his business as he dreams of keeping cows for milk production, despite the challenges of price fluctuations and the dry seasons where animals lack water and pastures. James will use the loan to buy cows to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy cows to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Ana Melissa

texts.es:
La señora Ana Melissa de 24  años de edad, vive con su mama y hermanos  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 6 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio vende todo lo relacionada a la canasta básica.
Doña Ana Melissa vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Ana Melissa está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos para como pollo, arroz, frijoles, harina, manteca, jabón, frescos, huevos, queso, azúcar, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, tiene muchos deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Diciembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Ana Melissa is a 24-year old woman who lives with her mother and siblings in their own house. She has been selling basic products for 6 years. Ana Melissa lives in a community of San Lorenzo, South of Honduras, and is an entrepreneur who is willing to get ahead and improve her quality of life. 

Ana Melissa is requesting a loan to buy products, such as chicken, rice, beans, flour, butter, soap, fresh food, eggs, cheese, sugar, etc. Thanks to this loan she will increase her income and improve her quality of life. She is looking forward to working with Prisma. 

Her dream is to have a well stocked business and to improve her future with her family. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - December 2014

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, beans, flour, butter, soap, fresh food, eggs, cheese, sugar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mbooga Bakyara Group

texts.en:
Mbooga Bakyara group was founded in a trading centre in Kanoni, Kiruhura disrict, Uganda. The group comprises both men and women. They all deal in several businesses.

Moneda is a 34-year-old, single woman with four children. All her children are in school. Moneda owns a small restaurant which she runs with capital of UGX 500,000. She supports this with a poultry farm where she earns income to look after her family. She has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 to help her buy equipment to use in running her business. Her customers are shop owners in the trading centre. She will use the rest of the money to pay school fees for her children.

Moneda is a very honest and hard working woman. She hopes to be the best poultry farmer in the whole village.  The group is thankful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity and support.

loans.use: To buy cooking and service utencils

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 54 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Alice has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal for seven years and also earns an income from tailoring shop and farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Alma has been in this business for four years. Alma earns more income from her general store and farming sugarcane.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Katwebumbe Youth Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman with six children. She is a repeat client and has so far acquired five loans from UGAFODE Microfinance. She is grateful to Kiva lenders through UGAFODE because her previous loans enabled her to acquire a plot of land and even build a house for her family, thanks to the low interest rates and the long repayment period. 

Sarah is taking this loan to boost her charcoal stove making business by buying firewood and more clay for moulding and baking the stoves. With this she is hopeful that she will mould more stoves therefore increasing sales and profit. She is hardworking and thanks Kiva lenders and UGAFODE for being there for her and group in times of financial need.

loans.use: To buy fire wood for making charcoal stoves

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Margie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Margie's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Amia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Amia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Amia is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Amia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 44 años de edad es casada tiene 6 hijos vive en Echeandia provincia de Bolivar, pertenece a la ventanilla rural Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura hace algunos años, Solicita el credito para la compra de insumos y semillas para sembrar naranjilla,para aumentar la produccion las compars realiza en Echeandia mismo donde los otros productores, su sueño es sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles una buena educación. 
En su tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a sus hijos y a sus animales.
texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old, married and has six children. She lives in the Echeandia province of Bolivar and belongs to the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) communal bank.

She has been farming for some years. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies and seed so that she can grow naranjilla fruit and increase her production. As other producers do, she makes her purchases in Echeandia. Her dream is to help her children get ahead in life and to provide them with a good education. In her free time she likes to look after her children and her animals.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and seed.

loans.name: Jessica Patricia

texts.es:
Jessica es una joven ecuatoriana emprendedora de 19 años, soltero, oriundo de parroquia Saquisilí del cantón del  mismo nombre de la ciudad de Latacunga vive en Saquisilí en un barrio llamado Unión Narváez, con el sacrificio de sus padres está estudiando la universidad pero a la vez trabaja como comerciante de aliños en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad, inclusive fuera de ella.
Jessica pese a la difícil situación económica que viven en su familia ha demostrado a todos que ella pude salir adelante, actualmente tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de aliños y especias, para lo cual se acercó a Fundación Alternativa a solicitar un crédito el mismo que lo utilizará para incrementar su mercadería. 
Jessica agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en: Jessica is an entrepreneurial young Ecuadorian aged 19, single, and a native of the Saquisilí parish of the cantón (county) of the same name in the city of Latacunga. She lives in Saquisilí, in a neighbourhood called Unión Narváez. With the sacrifice of her parents she is studying at university but at this time she works as a seasonings dealer in different markets in the city, including those far away from her. Despite the difficult economic situation experienced by her family Jessica has shown to everyone that she could succeed. She currently has a small business selling seasonings and spices, for which she has approached Fundacion Alternativa to request a loan to use to increase her merchandise. Jessica is grateful to Fundacion Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for making growth in her personal and work life possible.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise. With the resulting income she wants to finish her studies and help her parents.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert comes from Kyarutanga. He is married with four children who are all in school. He has a hardware store but still on small scale. He keeps his wares at home and only takes it to the market on the market days because he still cannot afford to pay monthly rent and also meet his family needs. He is taking a loan of ugx 1,500,000 to help him increase on his capital to serve all the needs of his customers. He is hard working and honest and is confident that with continuous financial support, he will get to his dream destination of freedom from poverty.

loans.use: To buy stock of nails, pangas and saucepans

loans.name: Garba

texts.en: Garba is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Garba joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Aminu, Ado, and Harisu. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Garba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Garba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 percent higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Garba spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Omar Heriberto

texts.en: Omar is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two sons. He owns two taxis. He drives one and hires someone to drive the other. Omar is asking for a loan because one of the cars needs some repairs. He says that his biggest achievement is being able to gain stability and save to buy a second taxi.

loans.use: To Fix his Taxi.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en: Nelida is 31 years old. She is not married but lives with her boyfriend. She doesn't have kids. She has worked in retail for more than 10 years. She started selling in the streets and 18 months ago, she opened a grocery store. She is asking for a loan to buy some groceries and candies for her store. Her biggest accomplishment is having the courage to open her business and her goal is to make it grow.

loans.use: To invest in groceries and candies.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: Andrea is 20 years old and is studying international trade. She is single and supports herself selling cosmetics. She is asking for a loan to buy more cosmetics. She says that the Christmas season is the best season of the year because many clients buy them as gifts. She says that her biggest achievement is being able to pay for her college education. Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for door to door sales.

loans.name: Mai-Anguwa

texts.en: Mai-Anguwa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Mai-Anguwa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children. Before joining Babban Gona, he had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mai-Anguwa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, he spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: El Colegio Sur Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento El Colegio Sur compuesta por diez integrantes de las cuales nueve son mujeres y un varón se dedican a distintas actividades como; tapizado de vehículos, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares,  venta de jugo, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos y venta de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios este banco ya saco crédito con la institución anteriormente, por problemas en el grupo se reestructuro un 30 por ciento, por personas que se conocen entre ellas.
Elena es la representante de grupo (en la foto la que está sentada en medio) tiene  45 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de 24 y 16 su actividad es la venta de ropa.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, trabajadora, responsable y buena madre. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Sur, caracterizada por el creciente comercio en todas las áreas de clima tropical, húmedo con una temperatura constante de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Elena es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo crespo, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español. vive en una casa propia de la familia construida de ladrillo y cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Sus deseo de superación la impulsaron a formar una banca de personas con variedad de negocios Ella vende productos según la temporada, por ejemplo; en época navideña compra juguetes, adornos navideños, árboles de navidad, luces, etc., por mayor para ofertarlos en las ferias y mercados, pasada esa fecha realiza compras para las fiestas de carnaval como; disfraces, globos de agua, pistolas de agua, en ambas fechas también ropa. Su marketing ronda según la fecha y la fiesta. Su sueño es tener su propia tienda en un lugar fijo y comercial para ya no seguir ambulando, ella desea realizar la compra por mayor de mercadería (ropa) para ofertarlos antes de las fiestas de fin de año y continuar con su actividad. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elena solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor por temporada para ofertarlos en las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
