Ma. Pinky is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of a 10-year-old child from Iloilo, Philippines. She makes a living through her rice retail business. Ma. Pinky has been in the business for more than 10 years now. 

Ma. Pinky is asking for a loan to buy more rice to sell. With a loan, she will be able to improve her rice stock to sell, thus augmenting her profit and income.

In the future, Ma. Pinky hopes of making her business successful and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is 62 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Romana is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Romana has been farming sugarcane for 24 years, and also earns additional income from a butcher shop.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mercedita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from poultry and a general store. 

Mercedita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall for her buy and sell vegetables business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mercedita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Marjorie works hard to support her family. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing food vending businesses. Marjorie has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF.

Marjorie is requesting a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of bananas to sell in her food stall. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Aijan

texts.ru: Айжан, успешно погасила свой предыдущий кредит. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании.  Она по-прежнему занимается перепродажей скота на скотном рынке города. В выходные дни она продает 5-6 штук годовалых бычков, ежемесячная прибыль в среднем составляет около 30,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве у Айжан есть 1 корова. В целях увеличения поголовья скота в обороте, она вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Айжан намерена и в дальнейшем заниматься этим бизнесом.
texts.en:
Aijan successfully paid of her previous loan. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who gave her financial support. As before, she works reselling livestock at the city livestock market. On weekends she sells five to six yearling steers, and her average monthly income is about 30,000 KGS. On her farm she currently has one cow. 

With the goal of further increasing the number of cattle she is able to turn over, she has again turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase livestock, as she wants to continue with this business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to sell at the market

loans.name: Rosas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS BLANCAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Valeriana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de lubricantes, venta de mantas, venta de salteñas, venta de queso, venta de papa, venta de chompas y mantas, venta de palos de madera, venta de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Valeriana es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de lubricantes; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo iniciando con un poco capital, posteriormente decide ampliarlo con los ahorros que tenía. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lubricantes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “ROSAS BLANCAS” credit group will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the German Busch center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Valeriana is the president. The businesses that the members of the credit group have are varied. Among them are: selling lubricants, selling salteñas, selling cheese, selling potatoes, selling sweaters and blankets, selling wood poles, and selling jackets.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Valeriana. She says that this is the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Right now, she has a business which is a lubricant store. She says that she learned this business from her husband, starting with little capital. Later she decided to expand it with the savings she had. 

The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying lubricants wholesale. She will acquire them from sellers in the city of La Paz and later sell them by order to the customers. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the trainings and the area of health that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy lubricants wholesale.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan  tiene 35 años de edad  habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Juan se dedica a la venta de pan francés y papas fritas de manera ambulante. Juan es un hombre visionario quien le gusta aprovechar las temporadas como la navideña para vender sus productos. Juan desea fortalecer sus negocio por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de papas, aceite, harina, atc. con el fin de cubrir una mayor cuota de mercado y poder así aumentar sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan, 35, lives in his own house with his family.  He earns a living selling French bread and fried potatoes as a street vendor.  Juan's a visionary man who likes to make the most of seasons like Christmas to sell his products.

Juan wants to strengthen his business, so he's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in buying potatoes, oil, flour, etc., so he can cover a bigger portion of the market and be able to increase his sales and his income.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, oil, flour, etc. to improve his sales and income

loans.name: G.s. Amor Y Fe Group

texts.es:
El G.S. AMOR Y FE ESTA CONFORMADO POR CUATRO INTEGRANTES MADRES SOLTERAS CON OCHO HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON  ORIGINARIOS DE NAGAROTE, LUGAR QUE SE CARACTERIZA POR  SU COMIDA Y BEBIDA TÍPICA, SON PERSONAS RESPONSABLES, TRABAJADORAS, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL. TODAS TIENE DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONÓMICAS, PARA SOBREVIVIR CON SUS FAMILIAS. ACTIVIDAD QUE LA DESEMPEÑAN CON MUCHO GUSTO, YA QUE ES EL SUSTENTO DE SUS HIJOS. 
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA ES ADRIANA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD UN TALLER DE CARPINTERÍA HEREDADO DE SU PADRES, EL CUAL DESDE HACE CINCO AÑOS ESTA BAJO SU ADMINISTRACION. EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN, EL CUAL TIENE PEDIDO DE CLIENTES FIJOS, ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS  DIEZ HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS SERVICIOS,  EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO EN LA COMPRA DE MADERA, PINTURA, BARNIZ CLAVOS, PERNO, ETC PARA LA ELABORACIÓN DE MUEBLE Y CUMPLIR CON LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES.  EL G.S. AMOR Y FE AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Amor y Fe" (Love and Faith) is composed of four members. They are single mothers with eight children under their care. They are originally from Nagarote, a place characterized by its typical food and drinks. They are responsible, hard-working women who seek self-improvement. They all work different jobs in order to support their families. They gladly work their jobs, since this is how they support their children. 

As a result of her desire to move forward, Adriana is the coordinator of the group. She has a carpentry workshop, which she inherited from her parents. It has been under her administration for the past five years. The business is located inside her home, and she fills orders from regular customers. She dedicates ten hours per day to her business, offering her services. She is requesting a loan to buy carpentry materials such as wood, paint, varnish, nails, pins, etc. in order to make furniture and meet the demands of her customers.

The solidarity group "Amor y Fe" gives thanks to Kiva lenders for helping people with limited resources from poor countries such as Nicaragua have decent ways to make a living.

loans.use: to buy carpentry materials such as wood, paint, varnish, nails, pins, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Elizabeth

texts.es:
BLANCA DE 44 AÑOS DE EDAD, CASADA CON TRES HIJOS TODOS ESTÁN ESTUDIANDO, ES ORIGINARIA DE LEÓN, ESTA JOVEN MADRE SE CARACTERIZA POR SER LUCHADORA POR SUS  HIJOS, Y POR OBTENER INDEPENDENCIA ECONÓMICA,  Y APOYAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR POR TAL RAZÓN TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA PULPERIA EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN PARA APOYAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR. Y DE DICHA FORMA PROPORCIONARLE  A SUS HIJOS SUS ESTUDIOS Y ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA, Y CUMPLIR SUS SUEÑOS COMO FORMARLOS EN-PROFESIONALES.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA UNA PULPERIA  QUE CONSISTEN EN VENDER PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES EN CANTIDADES PEQUEÑAS COMO: ARROZ, FRÉJOLES, AZÚCAR, CIGARRILLOS, ACEITE, HUEVOS, PAN, HIELO, FOSFOREROS, DETERGENTE ETC. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO O UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS PARA BRINDARLE UN BUEN SERVICIO A SU CLIENTELA Y OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO, PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS.BLANCA A AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 44 and married with three children in school, is a native of León.  This young mother is characterized by fighting for her children and fighting to obtain economic independence to support the expense of the home.  For this reason, she has a small convenience store in her house to support her husband with household expenses, and thereby to provide her children with education and economic stability, and to fulfill her dreams of training them to be professionals.

Thanks to her desires to get ahead, she has a convenience store business, which consists of selling edible products in small quantities, such as rice, beans, sugar, cigarettes, oil, eggs, bread, ice, matches, detergent, etc.  She spends twelve hours every day in her business offering products so she can provide good service to her customers and have a better income.  The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and supply her business, so that in the near future she can have better income.  Blanca is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to people of low resources and poor countries, like Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent means of work.

loans.use: to invest in her convenience store with products such as rice, beans, sugar cigarettes, oil, eggs, bread, ice, matches, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Doña Rosa nació en la ciudad de Matagalpa en el año de 1965. A los 20 años de edad conoció a Humberto, su pareja, ellos ya tienen 27 años de estar juntos, y han procreado 4 hijos que ya son mayores de edad, e incluso ya tiene la alegría de ser abuela. Rosa y su familia Actualmente viven en el sardinal ya en este lugar tiene 8 años de vivir. Doña Rosa actualmente tiene unas tierras en donde tiene sembrado café el cual está en cosecha también siembra granos básicos mas que todo para consumo. Ella se siente bien trabajando en su parcela y cosechando su café comenta que le deja sus centavos pero que a las vez lo tiene que tener bien atendido para que le siga dando el pan diario de cada día. En esta comunidad del sardinal no hay energía electrica, se alumbra actualmente con candelas y tiene que tener focos para salir al patio de noche. es por eso que doña Rosa solicita un préstamo para así poder hacer la compra de un sistema solar este sistema será de gran beneficio para todos los miembros que viven con ella ya que a veces llegan sus hijos y sus nietos y ya así se podrán alumbrar con luz producida por bujías, ella estaría muy agradecida si le brinda la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en: Rosa was born in the city of Matagalpa in the year 1965. When she was 20 years old, she met Humberto, her spouse. They have been together for 27 years and have had 4 children who are now adults, and she even has the joy of being a grandmother. Rosa and her family currently live in El Sardinal and they have been living in this place for 8 years. Rosa currently has some land where she is has coffee planted, which is producing a harvest. She also grows basic grains primarily for consumption.  She feels good working her plot and growing her coffee. She says that it provides her with cash but that at the same time she has to be very attentive so that it continues providing her with her daily bread each day. In this community of El Sardinal, there isn't electricity; they currently light things with candles and have to have flashlights to go out to the yard at night. For this reason, Rosa asks for a loan to be able to purchase a solar power system. This system will be a great benefit for all the family members who live with her since sometimes her children and grandchildren come and in this way they will be able to use light produced by bulbs, if she is offered this opportunity for a loan to purchase a solar power system.

loans.use: to purchase a solar power system.

loans.name: Jenelyn Ruffa

texts.en:
Jenelyn Ruffa is 23 years old and married. She runs a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines and also earns additional money from selling food.  Jenelyn Ruffa works hard to support her family. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. Jenelyn Ruffa successfully repaid her previous loans.

Jenelyn Ruffa is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of clothing to sell for her ready-to-wear business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thu is the Kinh woman. Her family consists of 4 members including her, her husband, her daughter and her son. Her family currently lives in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation, so each year after deducting all costs the income is just enough to cover the family’s living cost and to save the little amount left. The saved amount is not enough to buy fertilizer for the next crop; therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for the custard-apple and longan garden.

She hopes the loan will help her family invest in the custard-apple and longan garden with high efficiency, and thanks to the hard working and learning, her gardens with all trees will be laden with fruits. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, salts, aqua, vegetable seasoning, detergents, noodles, biscuits, cigarettes and other things to sell.

loans.name: Cris-Ann

texts.en:
Cris-Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has run her business for the past seven years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Cris-Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with help of loans through NWTF. 

Cris-Ann is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients such as frozen foods, meat, and other products for her food vending business. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase frozen foods, meat, and other products

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en: Romulo runs a sari-sari (or variety) store where he sells basic household merchandise like noodles, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, soap, seasonings and soft drinks. He is a single man who lives in Ormoc, Leyte. and supplements his income by selling food items he makes at home. Romulo has requested  a loan to buy additional groceries to sell in his store and supplies such as meat, vegetables, seasonings and rice to make more food items to sell. He wants to keep his store stocked with interesting items to buy, and to make more food to sell. His goal for the future is to continue investing in his business so that he can improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in his store and use to make food to sell.

loans.name: Guia

texts.en:
Guia is a fruit vendor from Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has four dependents. Guia sells fruits like bananas and snack foods. This has been her income for the past 10 years now.

Guia is asking for a loan to buy more bananas to sell. With a loan, she will be able to augment her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.

Guia hopes of making her business a success in the future. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery es una mujer de 30 años de edad, casada, tiene cuatro hijos, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan y masitas típicas.
Ella es responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad del Torno un área caracterizado por los descendientes de inmigrantes de etnias del lugar como los ‘Ayoreos’ y mineros relocalizados de occidente, de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura constante de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Rosmery es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza, Vive en casa de sus padres que está construida de ladrillo y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan y masitas típicas, como; Cuñapé (Pequeño bollo hecho de harina de yuca con queso), Empanada de arroz (Horneado de arroz y queso), Zonzo (Puré de yuca mezclado con queso y formado en un palito para cocinarse al horno), Bizcochos de trigo (Bollitos duros de harina de trigo), Masaco de plátano (Plátano de freír aplastado y mezclado con queso, cerdo o charque de res). "Fue mi madre de quien aprendí el oficio y ahora administro mi negocio. Me enseñó todos los secretos…" comenta. Su sueño es tener una panadería propia en un lugar fijo para ya no tener que vender ambulando. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de materiales de panadería, como; Cuchara plástica: se necesita una cuchara para mezclar harina y levadura. Bowls de acero inoxidable: para las masas. Se utilizan con tapa para masas madre. Raspador de masa: vital para quitar la masa pegada. Balanza de precisión: Imprescindible pesar los ingredientes con medidas exactas y en pequeñas cantidades. Jarra medidora: Una jarra con marcas visibles es muy útil para medir los líquidos. Cucharas medidoras: para tener ingredientes con la medida justa. Rodillo: se utilizan para estirar la masa, y otros. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosmery solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de panadería, para elaborar masitas tradicionales.
texts.en:
Rosmery is a 30-year-old woman who is married with four children, and her business is making and selling bread and traditional baked goods.

She is responsible and hard working. She carries out her business in the town of Torno, an area home to descendants of immigrants of the ethnicity of places like “los Ayoreos” and miners relocated from the west. It is characterized by its warm, tropical, humid climate with a constant temperature of 30 degrees centigrade during the whole year. 

Rosmery has a dark-skinned complexion, long black hair and a short stature. Her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and the business that she’s in. She lives in her parents’ house, which is made of brick, has potable water, electricity and a sewage system. 

Her business is making and selling bread and traditional baked goods like cuñapé (a small roll made of yucca flour and cheese), rice empanada (baked with rice and cheese), zonzo (yucca puree mixed with cheese and shaped on a stick to cook in the oven), wheat biscuits (small hard rolls of wheat flour), banana masaco (fried smashed banana mixed with cheese, pork and dried beef).

“It was from my mother that I learned my trade and now I administer my business. She taught me all the secrets,” she says. Her dream is to have her own bakery in a fixed place, so that she no longer needs to sell as a street vendor. 

She wants to grow her business by buying bakery materials like plastic spoons (spoons are needed to mix the flour and yeast); stainless steel bowls for the dough, which are used with lids for sourdough; a dough scraper (vital for removing stuck dough); a precision scale (essential for weighing ingredients in exact measurements and in small quantities); a measuring pitcher (a pitcher with visible marks is very useful for measuring liquids); measuring spoons (to have ingredients with the right measurement); a rolling pin (used to roll out the dough) and others. 

This is the first loan cycle with this institution in five years that is going toward this activity. For these reasons Rosmery requests a loan to purchase bakery materials to make traditional baked goods.

loans.use: to buy bakery materials.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 41-years-old and has four children.  Vivian is married and has three children who are in school.

Vivian is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Vivian requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Vivian has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Thanh's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thanh was born in Thailand in 1983 and lives with her husband and two daughters and son in the Mai Son district of Son La province. Her older daughter is studying in a secondary school, while her younger daughter and son are studying at a primary school in the Mai Son district. Her family’s main income is from grocery selling and chicken raising. She needs to pay for her children's education and living expenses and is requesting this loan to make sure that her children can continue in school. She will work hard to ensure that she repays this loan fully and on time.

loans.use: to pay for her child's education.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Helen is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Cayetano está en su ciclo número 3° Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una de las integrantes están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Susan, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, es decir en un nivel medio. Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de zapatos que hace, está teniendo los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de zapatos varios, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas, luchando por su familia y por sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group named “San Cayetano” is in its third loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another so that they can move forward. The members have taken the poverty elimination survey so that they can put forth their best effort in order for them to grow.

One of the members is Sra. Susan. Her latest survey indicated that she is at a Stage 2 poverty level, which is a moderate level. Through her effort and work, Susan makes her living by selling shoes. This is how she is able to help her family.

Susan is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of various types of shoes. This will allow her to continue her sales as she strives on behalf of her family and her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy various types of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Vitaliya

texts.en:
Vitaliya is divorced and she has a daughter. Vitaliya has her own business. She sells women's clothes at the market. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Vitaliya owns a kiosk. She makes her biggest sales on dresses, pants and sweaters.  She is a friendly, open and hardworking person.

Vitaliya is asking for a loan of 31,000 UAH to increase the assortment of women's clothes. During the winter holidays there is a great demand for women's clothing.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of women's winter clothes to better serve her clients.

loans.name: Roger Alberto

texts.es:
Roger es un señor casado, con dos  pequeños hijos en edad escolar a los que le proporciona su ayuda para su  desarrollo, y se desempeña como guarda de seguridad interna en un centro de salud  desde hace  siete años en una comunidad rural donde habita con su familia.
Este señor visito a la oficina de Ceprodel para obetener su primer financiamiento ya que tiene la urgencia de terminar de construir el techo de su vivienda , dicho financiamiento lo invertiria en la compra de cemento y laminas de zinc los que vendria a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida  en su seno familiar.
texts.en:
Roger is a married man with two young school-aged children whom he supports for their development. He has worked as a security guard in a heath center for the past seven years in a rural community where he lives with his family. 

This gentleman visited the Ceprodel offices to get his first loan since he urgently needs to finish constructing the roof on his house. This loan would be invested in the purchase of cement and zinc sheeting, which would improve his conditions and level of living in his family home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and zinc sheeting.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a 67-year-old married woman and a mother of two grown up children from Iloilo, Philippines. Alicia runs a small sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Alicia has been in the business for more than 15 years now.

Alicia is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, bread and biscuits, eggs and others. With a loan, she will be able to improve her stock, thus, allowing her to attract more buyers in her store.

Alicia hopes of expanding her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, bread and biscuits, eggs and others

loans.name: Grupo G Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del “Grupo G” son mujeres muy alegres, se conocen desde hace varios años y se apoyan en las situaciones más difíciles; pertenecen a una comunidad mazahua, aún conservan su lengua materna, algunas tradiciones y fiestas patronales que surgieron gracias a la religión cristiana.

Doña Aurelia es muy platicadora, siempre esta de muy buen humor, tiene 47 años de edad y está casada con Don Felipe quien se dedica a la venta de carnitas; juntos formaron una familia con tres hijas aunque actualmente ya sólo una depende de ellos. 

Aurelia está solicitando un préstamo a VisionFund y KIVA para comprar una marrana e iniciar a criar los animalitos porque durante 10 años se ha dedicado a preparar las tradicioneles "carnitas" y venderlas en tacos. Aunque anteriormente ella compraba la carne, ahora quisiera encargarse de todo el proceso ella misma para garantizar la calidad de los tacos. 

El primer negocio de Aurelia fue una tienda de abarrotes y aunque todo funcionaba muy bien un día simplemente se le ocurrió sacrificar un cerdo que compró con sus ahorros, preparó la carne y comenzó a vender tacos. "Ese día me fue muy bien, las ganancias fueron mucho mejor de lo que yo esperaba” comentó. Desde entonces Don Felipe y Aurelia se han dedicado a la compra y venta de cerdos para prepararlos en carnitas, con el tiempo cerraron la tienda de abarrotes, pero el negocio sigue creciendo, actualmente ya son contratados para preparar las carnitas en las fiestas del pueblo. Cada vez que tienen un evento deben trabajar dos días continuos para quedar muy bien con sus clientes. 

Una de las dificultades que enfrenta Doña Aurelia es la distancia que hay entre su casa y el espacio donde conserva a sus animales, tiene que caminar varios kilómetros para atenderlos y todo el tiempo se preocupa por el bienestar de los mismos. Ella está dispuesta a hacer todo lo posible para mejorar esta situación y criar a los cerditos porque el más grande de sus anhelos es tener una carnicería, ya cuenta con una cortadora y una rebanadora pero aún le hace falta material. 

Las demás integrantes del grupo son Ana Maura quien invertirá en herramientas para mecánica; Gabriela, en pollos; Julia, en Abarrotes y Karina y Zenaida, en tela para elaboración de trajes mazahuas.

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco del municipio. En la foto las integrantes muestran algunas servilletas que ellas mismas elaboran para después venderlas así obtener un ingreso extra, Doña Virginia es quien viste el suéter rosa*
texts.en:
The members of “Grupo G” are very cheerful women. They have known each other for several years and they support each other in the most difficult times. They belong to a Mazahua community. They still preserve their mother tongue, some traditions and the patron saint festivals that exist thanks to the Christian religion. 

Aurelia is very chatty. She is always in a good mood. She is 47 years old and married to Felipe, who sells carnitas. Together they made a family with three daughters although right now only one of them depends on them.  

Aurelia is asking for a loan from VisionFund and KIVA to buy a sow and start to raise the animals. For 10 years she has worked making the traditional "carnitas", and selling them in tacos. Although previously she would buy the meat, now she would like to do the whole process herself to guarantee the quality of the tacos. 

The first business Aurelia had was a general store and although everything worked very well, one day she just decided to slaughter a pig that she bought with her savings. She prepared the meat and started to sell tacos. "That day it went very well for me. Profits were a lot better that what I expected”, she commented. Since then, Felipe and Aurelia have bought and sold pigs to make carnitas. Over time, they closed the store, but the business kept growing. Right now she has contracts to make carnitas for the town festivals. Every time they have an event they have to work two days straight so they can do right by their customers. 

One of the difficulties that Aurelia faces is the distance between her house and the place where she keeps her animals. She has to walk several kilometers to take care of them and she is always worried about their well being. She is willing to do everything possible to improve this situation and raise the piglets because her biggest wish is to have a butcher shop. She has a meat cutter and a slicer, but she still lacks some materials.  

The other members of the group are Ana Maura, who will invest in tools for mechanics; Gabriela, in chickens; Julia, in groceries; and Karina and Zenaida, in fabric to make Mazahuas traditional clothes. 

*The photograph was taken on the steps of the town hall. In the photo some napkins are shown that they make themselves to later sell and obtain extra income. Virginia is the one in the pink sweater*

loans.use: to buy a sow.

location.town: La Cienega, San Felipe del progreso

loans.name: Cecilia Sebastiana

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Simón Bolívar se reúne cada quince días en el sitio Cárcel Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Cecilia, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 19, 12 y 8 años, el mayor estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Cecilia es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganar lo suyo para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene una pequeña fábrica de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas), ella les paga a dos personas para que elaboren este producto y ella es la encargada de vender a muchos comerciantes que llegan hasta su fabrica para luego llevar los ladrillos a otras ciudades, lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo y ayuda dando trabajo a estas personas que trabajan con ella.
Este crédito es para comprar leña, aserrín, agua y palmito que son los materiales que emplean para elaborar los ladrillos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The loan group Simón Bolívar meets every two weeks in Cárcel Cantón Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its artwork, which is internationally and nationally recognized. This place is famous for its straw hats. 

Cecilia lives in this region. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children ages 19, 12, and 8. Her oldest child is in high school, while her youngest two are in elementary school. Cecilia's husband works as a driver. 

Cecilia is a hardworking woman who likes to earn what she can to help her husband pay their household expenses. She has a small brick-making factory (a materia used in the construction of houses). Cecilia pays two people to make this product and she is in charge of selling the bricks to businessmen who come to her factory to buy bricks to sell in other cities. She has been working in this business for 10 years. It has helped her to earn a living as well as help others by providing employment to those who work under her. 

This loan will let Cecilia buy firewood, sawdust, water, and palm hearts, which are supplies used to make her bricks. From the beginning Cecilia has been a part of this loan group. She likes the group because the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dream is to move forward.

loans.use: to buy firewood, sawdust, water, and palm hearts.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es:
La señora  Ana de 56  años de edad, no  tiene hijos y es soltera tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de venta de golosinas, como baleadas, frescos naturales, tacos, enchiladas, vende este tipo de producto  en temporada escolar y después se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y zapatos.
Doña Ana su venta es en los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo y de su comunidad es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Ana está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de blusas, faldas, vestidos, camisas, pantalones, zapatos, etc. Para aprovechar la temporada navideña que es cuando más vende, con el apoyo de este préstamo la señora  desea suplir la necesidad de financiamiento y mejorar su calidad de vida y también poder ofrecerles a sus clientes más productos.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Diciembre del 2014
texts.en:
Ana, 56 years old, doesn't have any children and is single. She has her own house and she has worked for a number of years selling snacks such as baleadas [Honduran flour tortillas with beans and cheese], natural soft drinks, tacos, and enchiladas.  She sells these type of products during the school year and later, she works selling used clothing and shoes.
supply
Ana makes her sales in the neighborhoods and colonies of San Lorenzo and in her community. She is a hard-working woman with desires to get ahead.

Ana is asking for a loan to purchase blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, shoes, etc. to take advantage of the Christmas season when she sells the most. With the support of this loan, she wants to meet the need for financing and improve her quality of life and also be able to offer her customers more products.

Her dream is to improve her business. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – December 2014

loans.use: to purchase blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, shoes, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Angela Herlinda

texts.es:
La señora Ángela de 35 años de edad,  es  casada  tiene dos hijos  que depende de ella, se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de venta de abarrotería como ser: detergentes, jabón, frescos, jugos, churros, pollo, lácteos, y también vende tortillas.  
Doña Ángela esta solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de abarrotería en general como arroz, azúcar, harina, aceite, huevos, pan, café, leche, maíz y leña para sus negocios. Con el apoyo de este préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten al tener más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y poder así mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida es el segundo préstamo que solicita a Prisma, su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su casa.   

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Angela is 35 years old, married, and has two children who depend on her. For various years now she has had a business selling groceries such as detergents, soap, soft drinks, juices, fried bread, chicken, dairy products, and, also, she sells tortillas.

Angela is soliciting a loan to purchase groceries in general, such as rice, sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil, eggs, bread, coffee, milk, corn and firewood for her business. With the help of this loan, she hopes that her sales will increase, by having more products to offer her customers, and thus, to improve her income and her quality of life. This is the second loan she has requested through PRISMA. 

Her dream is to improve her business and her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - December 2014

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil, eggs, bread, coffee, milk, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy more supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 18,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional quality used clothes which she resells. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Elizabeth dreams of having a house and lot for her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of quality used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is 26 years old. He is not married.  He sells local drinks and has been in this business for four years. With the loan requested, he would like to buy more sorghum to make more local drinks to sell.  The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and for welfare.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to make more local drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ernita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ernita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and buying and selling charcoal. Ernita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Ernita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Carmen Del Rosario

texts.es: Gracias al primer préstamo obtenido Carmen ha logrado salir adelante en sus dos  negocios la venta de ropa y de comida. Es por eso que solicita un segundo préstamo para comprar mesas y de esa forma atender mejor a los clientes que la visitan en su puesto de comida ya que una de sus metas es expandir el negocio para garantizar buena clientela y atención de calidad. Sus hijas la apoya en todo momento y está segura de que todo marchara bien.
texts.en: Thanks to the first loan that she got, Carmen has managed to get ahead in her two businesses of clothing and food sales. For this reason, she asks for a second loan to purchase tables and, in this way, better serve her customers who visit her at her food stall, since one of her goals is to expand the business to guarantee a good customer base and attention to quality. Her daughters help her all the time and it is sure that everything will turn out well.

loans.use: to purchase tables.

loans.name: Phong's Group

texts.en:
Phong was born in 1986 and is a Thai ethnic woman. She has been a member of M7-MFI since January 2013. Though she has just joined a loan group, and is the youngest member of the group, she has always been exemplary in supporting other loan group members. Phong currently lives with her husband and her two daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her oldest daughter will in first grade next year and her youngest daughter is in kindergarten in Mai Son district. Phong is a farmer. After deducting all of her costs, her income is just enough to cover food and save a small amount. Phong’s savings are not enough to pay for her children’s education fees 

Phong will use her part of this group loan to pay education fees for her children. Her loan will help provide better learning conditions for her children. Phong will work hard to get money to repay her M7-MFI loan on time.

loans.use: to pay education fees for her children

loans.name: Colleb

texts.en: Colleb is 37 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and children. He has been raising cattle for five years. With what he gets from his sales, he manages to pay some of his household expenses and tuition for his three children. Colleb is requesting a loan so that he can buy more cattle to continue with this work and to have a better income to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Yosip

texts.es:
El socio sigue  dedicándose al negocio de turismo, él socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas, él realiza tours a Machucpicchu, City Tours, Valle Sagrado entre otros tours que le soliciten, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar boletos turísticos entre otros.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to manage his tourism business. He appreciates the assistance that has been provided, so he promises to complete his loan payments in a disciplined manner. He conducts tours for Machu Picchu, City Tours, Sacred Valley, and other sites as requested. He is a responsible and industrious person who works in this manner so that his family can get ahead.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy tour tickets and other items.

loans.use: to buy tour tickets and other items.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is married and works hard to support her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She also earns additional income by selling vegetables, and has requested a loan for PHP 14,000 from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Mary Ann has sustained her business through hard work and four prior loans from NWTF and Kiva. She hopes to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has run her business for the past 11 years and works hard to support her family. Marilou has successfully repaid her previous loan.

Marilou is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients such as meat, vegetables, fruits, canned goods, and other items. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, fruits, canned goods, and other items

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is 46-years-old and married with three children, who are all in school. Sherlita works very hard to provide for them.

Sherlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Sherlita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Sherlita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Emelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Emelyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of vegetables to sell for her business.

Emelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Thanh's Group

texts.en: Mr Thanh was born in 1969 in Thailand and is currently living with his wife and two children, one daughter and one son, in the Mai Son district of Son La province. His daughter has completed vocational school and is working. His son is a student at the University of Resources and Environment's meteorological department. His family’s income comes from his and his wife's small salaries. He farms to earn additional income, but it is barely enough to cover the family’s day-to-day living expenses. That is why he is requesting a loan to pay for his son's education. This loan will allow him to invest in his son's education, and he plans to work hard to earn enough money to repay the loan.

loans.use: to pay for his children’s education fees

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 31 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. For the past seven years, she has run a fishing business in the Philippines. Alma is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Alma is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had enriched her business. She was able to buy additional gallons and supplies needed in their water distribution business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will let her borrow an amount of 28,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of gallons of mineral water to increase her business. An increase in profit will also result for her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Norma wants to give her family a better life someday. She knows that all her hard work in business will pay off. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Simón Bolívar se reúne cada quince días en el sitio Cárcel Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de  18, 16, 14 y 3 años, el mayor estudian en universidad, dos en colegio y el menor en inicial. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Ana es una mujer que le gusta trabajar por el bien de su familia, ella se dedica al comercio, compra y vende ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas),  compra a los artesanos de la zona almacena estos ladrillos en un deposito que ella tiene y luego los revende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su depósito para luego llevarlos a distintos lugares donde venden estos productos, lleva más de 3 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo que lo invierte en la educación de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar ladrillos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños seguir adelante y que sus hijos tengan una muy buena educación.
texts.en:
Simón Bolívar Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Cárcel area of Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its nationally and internationally known handcrafts and famous toquilla straw hats.

Ana, 36, lives here.  She's married and has four children, 18, 16, 14, and 3.  The oldest is in college, two are in school, and the youngest is in pre-school.  Her husband's a driver.

Ana's a woman who likes to work for the benefit of her family.  She earns a living in commerce buying and selling bricks, a material used in building houses.  She buys from artisans in the area and stores them in a warehouse she has, then re-sells them to merchants who go to her warehouse to take them to various places where they're sold.  She has been in this business for more than three years and she earns something to invest in her children's education.

This loan is to buy bricks.

Ana has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the help she gets from the loans.  Her dreams are to keep making progress and for her children to get a good education.

loans.use: to buy bricks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional piglets, pig feed and renovate the pig pen

loans.name: Carmina

texts.es:
Carmina es una mujer de 30 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos, y trabaja como corredora de seguros.
Ella es inteligente, independiente, activa, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su vida la desarrolla en la zona ‘villa fátima’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio informal y por las paradas de transporte público con salidas a poblaciones del norte de la ciudad, de clima frio y ventoso, vientos que llegan de la cordillera a una altura de 3600 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Carmina es de tez trigueña, cabello largo suelto castaño, ojos marrones, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el español y habla inglés porque lo necesita para su trabajo y para tratar con sus clientes. Su vida la comparte con sus 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Ella estudió la carrera de administración y trabaja como administradora de cartera en una empresa de seguros; “trabajo, estudio y me hago cargo de mis hijos, nadie me ayuda…” comenta. Su sueño es conseguir un empleo con un horario que le permita dedicar más tiempo a sus hijos. Debido a la competencia en el mercado laboral, ella necesita especializarse en área de administración financiera, estudiando la maestría de “Master en bussiness administration pymes” dictado por una universidad conocida. 
Es por esos motivos que Carmina solicita un préstamo para pagar las cuotas de su maestría profesional para mejorar sus oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Carmina is a 30-year-old woman, single, has 2 children, and works as an insurance broker.

She is intelligent, independent, active, dependable, responsible, and hard-working. He life takes place in the Villa Fátima zone, a place characterized by informal business and for the public transportation stops with destinations to places to the north of the city. It has a cold and windy climate, with winds that come from the mountains at an altitude of 3600 meters above sea level.

Carmina has olive skin, long loose brown hair, brown eyes, is of average height, her native language is Spanish, and she speaks English due to the necessity for her work and to work with her customers. She earned an administration degree and works as an portfolio manager in an insurance firm.  "I work, I study and I take care of my children, no one helps me..." she says. Her dream is to get a job with a schedule that allows her to spend more time with her children. Due to the competition in the labor market, she needs to specialize in financial administration, studying for a masters in business administration for small and medium-sized businesses, at a known university.  

For these reasons, Carmina asks for a loan to pay the fees for her professional degree to improve her work opportunities.

loans.use: to pay for a professional degree to increase her work opportunities.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe used a previous loan to successfully invest in her business and pay personal, household and business expenditures. She is requesting a new loan for 10,000 PHP to buy ingredients and food items to sell. The profits from her business will help her to pay the cost of both her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. Her goal for the future is to expand her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries and ingredients.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo en el distrito de Pomahuaca, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. Es un distrito mediano, sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de café de variedad catimor, cuenta con fincas de café propias en buen estado. Además se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno (vacas). Cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en la agricultura y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en el distrito. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, invirtiendo en su negocio podrá aumentar su nivel de ingresos logrando así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Zoila is 46 years old, a single mother, and lives with her son in Pomahuaca district, located in Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. It is a medium-sized district; its primary economic activities are agriculture, commerce, and animal husbandry. 

She works in agriculture, and has Catimor variety coffee plants. She has her own coffee plantation in good condition. In addition, she works raising cows. She has more than 15 years of experience in agriculture and has very good personal and work references in the district. The loan will be destined for the purchase of manure and fertilizers to maintain her coffee crop. Investing in her business, she will be able to increase the level of income she achieves to, in turn, improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer to maintain her coffee crop.

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en:
Beatrace, a fifty-two-year-old hard working, married woman, living in Kamwenge, Uganda, used her previous loan to buy more cattle for fattening. Her main business is currently farming, alongside cattle fattening where she earns a living. She started this business to look after her family and educate her children. She has hardships of competition and inadequate capital to buy farm inputs. However, her vision is to own a big and modernized coffee plantation in her area.
 
She is requesting a loan to buy more farm inputs for her coffee plantation.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Angelica Yadira

texts.es:
La señora Angélica de 26  años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hija  en su casa  propia, se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de venta de quesadillas y rosquillas,  sus clientes son personas de la zona y también tiene clientes en la zona de Pespire.
Doña Angélica vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como: maíz, cuajada, leña, aceite, etc. Para la elaboración de su producto con el apoyo de este préstamo espera que mejore su calidad de vida y le permita salir adelante en  su negocio, es un cliente nuevo  con deseos de trabajar  con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener una gran clientela para mejorar sus ventas.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Diciembre del  2014.
texts.en:
Mrs. Angelica is 26 years old. She lives with her husband and daughter in her own house. For 3 years she has been selling quesadillas and rosquillas (pastries). Her customers are people from her area and also from the area of Pespire.

Mrs. Angelica lives in a community in San Lorenzo in South Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead and she strives day by day to improve her quality of life.

She is requesting this loan to buy products like: corn, cheese curds, firewood, oil, etc to make her product. With the help of this loan she hopes that her quality of life will improve and that it will allow her business to grow. She is a new client with a desire to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a large clientele to improve her sales. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – December 2014.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese curds, firewood, oil, etc for her business.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en:
Shaban used the previous loan to buy sugar, cassava flour, and soap to sell. Shaban is 32 years old, and he is married with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He is operating a mobile money shop along side a retail shop of general merchandise in order to earn a living. 

Shaban has a dream of educating his children and having a stable working capital. However, he is faced with a challenge of market competition. Shaban wants money to buy cement and sand to plaster his house.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to plaster his house.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is an old man who is aged 31 and married with two children who all attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He runs a retail shop, mainly buying and selling soap, cooking oil, and plastics, among other items. This is supplemented by incomes from riding a motorcycle for transport. He has hopes of growing and expanding his business despite the challenge of high transportation fees. He will use the loan facility to buy more sugar and salt to sell.

The child in the photo is David's daughter who was with him at work.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Baby Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Baby Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Baby Jane is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  buy more stock to sell like cereals, noodles, eggs, canned goods, etc for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Baby Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like cereals, noodles, eggs, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Musa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ephraim, Obida and Amos.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Musa spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Karla Veronica

texts.es: Hace cinco años que Doña Karla inicio con el negocio de pulpería, decidió emprenderlo por la falta de empleo, además lo hizo para no depender de nadie y ser su propia jefa, asi como lograr estar al pendiente del desarrollo de su único hijo de 12 años de edad. Sus expectativas son seguir creciendo hasta convertirse en miscelánea. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas entre otros de esta manera aumentara su inventario y podrá generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña Karla opened a small grocery store five years ago. She decided to start this business due to the lack of other available work. In addition, Karla did it to be her own boss and not have to depend on anyone else, as well as to keep an eye on the development of her only son who is 12 years old.

Karla's hope is to continue to grow her business until it becomes a general store. She is requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, and soda among other things. This way, she will grow her inventory and be able to earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and soda among other things.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es: Aurelio, tiene la edad  de 78 años, está casado, vive con su esposa  que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de unos terneros para el engorde y que tengan buenas características en el rápido desarrollo y ganancia de peso en un plazo adecuado para poderlos vender y comprar mas. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto y las buenas condiciones de terreno y clima para poder tener estos animales y desarrollar terneros para en el futuro venderlos para carne. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Aurelio is 78 years old, married, and lives with his wife who is his highest priority. He intends to use this loan to buy a few calves for fattening. These animals must have good qualities that will help them develop rapidly and gain weight over an adequate period of time. This will help him to buy and sell more. Aurelio’s plan is to take advantage of the space in his pasture, the good land conditions, and suitable weather for raising these animals. In the future, he will sell the developed calves for meat production.

The purchase he will make with this loan will allow him to develop another business. He will be able to accumulate savings so that he can acquire more animals and invest more into his property. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Aurelio has not had any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is offering this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jessica is 41 years old, and has two children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business.

Jessica has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business

loans.name: Haruna Bala

texts.en:
Haruna Bala is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Haruna Bala joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yahuza, Suleman and Mika.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna Bala can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Haruna Bala spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion heads up for the next cropping season. She wants to be well prepared, especially for the much needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer so she applied for a loan from the cooperative. Concepcion hopes to save enough for her granddaughter's education.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce.

loans.name: Solidario La Pascua De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Solidario la Pascua de San Pedro El señor Marcos se dedica a la venta de blusas para damas en diferentes tallas, colores y calidad por docena y unidad desde hace 8 años, es vendedor ambulante de marcados de diferentes pueblos y también entrega por docena en algunos mercados de los pueblos más cercanos. Cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposa y tiene dos hijos que aun están pequeños.  Su sueño es ser un gran distribuidor de blusas por docenas y tener muchos mercados a quien entregar, quiere ser muy reconocido e inculcarles desde ya a sus hijos la vida de un negociante.  Es muy conocido en la comunidad como un hombre muy trabajador y honrado.  Tiene varias entregas ya que hacer de blusas a unos mercados pero necesita comprar para ajustar los pedidos que le han hecho por eso necesita un préstamo para comprar las docenas que le hacen falta y no quedarle mal a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Solidario La Pascua de San Pedro 

Marcos has earned a living for eight years selling women's blouses by the dozen and separately, in different styles, colors, and qualities.  He's a street vendor in markets in various towns, and he also sells by the dozen to some markets in the closest towns.

He has his wife's unconditional support, and he has two children who are still young.  His dream is to be a great wholesale blouse distributor and have a lot of markets to deliver to.  He wants to be very well known and instill in his children the life of a businessman.  He's very well known in the community as a very hardworking and honest man.

Marcos has several orders of blouses for some markets, but he needs to buy to adjust the requests that have been made.  He needs a loan to buy the dozens he needs so he won't look bad to his customers.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had enriched her business. She was able to buy recyclable materials and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will let her borrow again an amount of 27,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional foam, fabric, plastic, cotton, rugby and other scrap/recyclable materials she uses in making pillows. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Mercedita wants to have a boutique shop to store her products. She hopes to be able to expand soon. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials like foam, straw, fabric and cotton needed in her pillow-making business.

loans.name: Dúo Nueva Vicion Group

texts.es: Dúo Nueva Vición, integrado por doña Raquel es soltera. y se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado municipal, desde hace más de veinte años, doña Raquel también vende productos medicinales naturales, es muy conocida en el pueblo pues ella es muy amigable y le gusta tener su puesto limpio y ordenado y con una sonrisa que es lo que la caracteriza, su sueño es tener su negocio funcionando hasta donde Dios le permita y así tener un ingreso seguro, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de verduras y productos medicinales para la venta.
texts.en: One member of Team Nueva Vición is Raquel. She is single and she is in the business of selling vegetables in the city market, work that she has done for more than twenty years. She also sells natural medicinal products. She is well known in the village thanks to her friendly nature. She likes to keep her stand clean and orderly and always has a smile on her face. Her dream is to keep her business running as far as God permits and maintain a steady income. At this time, she is requesting a loan to buy vegetable and medicinal products to sell.

loans.use: buy vegetables and medicinal products to sell

loans.name: Felicito

texts.en:
Felicito is a fish vendor from Iloilo, Philippines. Felicito is a 64-year-old married man and a father of 11 grown up children. Felicito has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income.

Felicito needs additional capital for his business. He is requesting to take a loan to buy more fish to sell. With this, Felicito will be able to improve his fish stock, thus allowing him to sell more to the market for a good price.

In the future, Felicito hopes of making his fishing business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the reinvestment in the same venture.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf Dangoma is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Manasseh, Ephraim and Hassan.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf Dangoma can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Yusuf Dangoma spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy workshop materials for making windows and doors to sell.

loans.name: Bienvinido

texts.en:
Bienvinido is 58 years old, a married woman with 10 children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Bienvinido has a buying and selling livestock business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to sell.

Bienvinido has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 44 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mercy is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for the harvest and land preparation.

Mercy has been farming rice  for 12 years, and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for the harvest and land preparation

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Claire is 36 years old, and has three children who are in school.

Claire has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Claire has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonora is 35 years old, and has two children who are in school.

She has a nipa weaving business in the Philippines. Leonora requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her business.

Leonora has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her  business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  Marilyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net for her fishing business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Linda is 32 years old and two of her children are in school.

Linda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Linda has requested a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Linda has been in this business for five years. In the future, Linda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa, a 41-year-old married woman with six children in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For 10 years she has had a furniture-making business in the Philippines. 

Ma. Luisa Mar has requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her furniture-making business

loans.name: Maritza Patricia

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 25 años de edad es casada y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 6 maños vive en Echeandia en la Provincia de Bolivar, pertenece a la ventanilla rural Mujeres Emprendedoras.

Solicita el credito para la compra de joyas para aumentar el negocio y tener variedad, para tener un capital para seguir con el negocio, las compras realiza en Guayaquil cada mes, su sueño es sacar a su familia de la pobreza y darles una buena educación a sus hijos. Los desafios a los que se enfrenta es las enfermedades, en su tiempo libre le gusta estudiar y pasar con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza is 25 years old, married, and has two children (ages 8 and 6). She lives in Echeandia in Bolivar Province. Martiza is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women).

She is requesting a loan in order to buy jewelry. This will increase her business and give her more variety. By having this capital, Maritza will be able to continue her business.
