She makes her purchases in Guayaquil on a monthly basis. Her dream is to get her family out of poverty and to provide a good education for her children. The challenges she faces include having to deal with illnesses.

In her free time, Maritza enjoys studying and spending time with her children.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Bertha Rocio

texts.es:
Bertha mujer ecuatoriana de 27 años de edad, nació en la ciudad de Latacunga en la parroquia de Mulaló, vive en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos y su esposo, Bertha es una joven muy emprendedora y trabajadora, desde muy pequeña se dedicó a trabajar duro para ser un apoyo para sus padres, quienes lo han sacrificado todo para darle educación, pero que lamentablemente por no tener recursos económicos solamente le pudieron dar la educación primaria, pero esto no ha sido obstáculo para ella.
Bertha se dedica a la compra y venta de plantas ornamentales desde hace varios años, ella dedica diariamente a todas esta labores entre 6 y 8 horas, todo esto lo aprendió de sus padres, desde muy pequeña, quienes han sido para ella un ejemplo de lucha constante. 
Hoy está solicitando un crédito para la compra de más plantas ya que actualmente, la demanda es muy buena, esto ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y sustentar sus ventas para no perder sus clientes. Para Bertha lo más difícil de su trabajo es cuando tiene que trasladar sus plantas ya que no cuenta con vehículo apropiado para esto.
Vino a la Fundación por muy buenas referencias y quiere agradecer muchísimo a quienes forman parte de esta noble institución quienes le han abierto las puertas para poder cumplir con su necesidad, es por eso que agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Bertha is a 27-year-old Ecuadorian woman. She was born in the city of Latacunga in the parish of Mulaló. She lives in her own home with her husband and their three children. Bertha is an enterprising and hard-working young woman. She started working when she was quite young to help her parents out. They sacrificed everything to provide her with an education, but unfortunately they only had the economic resources to keep her in school through primary school. Nevertheless, this has not been an obstacle to her.

Bertha has been in the business of buying and selling ornamental plants for several years. She works every day around 6 to 8 hours and she learned the work from her parents when she was very young. To their daughter, they have been an example of never giving up.

At this time she is requesting a loan so that she can buy more plants, since demand is quite high right now. This will help her improve her income and sustain her sales, ensuring she does not lose any clients. For Bertha, the hardest part of her job is moving her plants since she doesn't have an appropriate vehicle for the work.

She came to the Foundation with excellent references and she offers many thanks to everyone in this noble institution who has opened doors to her and helped her meet her needs. In particular she thanks Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for making her personal and familial growth possible.

loans.use: buy ornamental plants and, later, a vehicle to haul them.

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs  Huong, born in 1990, is a Thai ethnic woman who lives with her husband and one lovely daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family lives mainly on her meager income derived from raising chickens and geese. Because her income is very small, she has to spend money very economically to sustain her family.

Because her savings are insufficient to pay for her daughter’s education fees,  Huong is requesting a loan to cover her daughter’s education fees. She will find an extra job to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time, and she hopes the loan can help her daughter have better conditions for studying in order to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to cover her daughter’s education fees

loans.name: Jardin De Eden Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JARDIN DE EDEN” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Angela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, venta de dulces, venta de mantas, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Angela es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió de su madre, hace varios años, iniciando con un poco capital y con un préstamo obtenido en Pro Mujer amplio su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para ampliación del negocio (compra de muebles por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de venta para la comodidad de sus clientes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen esta aumente una de las clientes, misma que tuvo que retirarse rápidamente por que tuvo que ir a su negocio
texts.en:
The "Jardin de Eden" (Garden of Eden) community bank will begin its fourth term as part of Pro Mujer, part of the Los Andes central business office. It has eight members and is run by a board of directors with Angela as the president. The members run a variety of businesses including selling vegetables, running neighborhood stores, selling clothing, selling candies, selling textiles, and weaving textiles.

This loan will benefit all of the small business owners in Angela's group. Angela says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years and that she joined at the invitation of a friend who was a client of the institution. She currently runs a business selling food, work which she says she learned from her mother several years ago. She began with a small amount of capital and then expanded with a loan from Pro Mujer.

This loan will be used to expand her business by buying furniture which she will get from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. She will use this to make the space where she does her sales more comfortable for her customers. This work allows her to earn money and support her family economically, as she is single and has one son. When asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the training and the health clinic that the institution offers. 

The picture is missing one of the group members as she had to leave quickly to get to her business.

loans.use: buy furniture for her food stall

loans.name: Dúo Virgen De Candelaria Group

texts.es: Dúo Virgen de Candelaria La encargada de este grupo es la señera Odilia quien tiene una tienda desde hace 7 años, también vende algunos almuerzos y tiene una pequeña librería en el mismo lugar, al lado de sus tres hijos y su esposo le da gracias a Dios porque su hijo está a punto de graduarse y es un gran logro para ella, su sueño es sacar adelante a sus otras dos hijas que están sacando la primaria y que cada día su tienda siga creciendo ya que la venta es una gran ayuda para ella. Necesita comprar varias cosas para la tienda como, golosinas, maíz, azúcar, arroz, sopas instantáneas aguas gaseosas, jugos y un poco de fruta ya que también pone ventas de temporada.  El dinero que tiene no le alcanza y por eso necesita un préstamo para poder comprar lo que le falta.
texts.en:
“Virgen de Candelaria” Group

Sra. Odilia is the leader of this group. She has a store that she has managed for seven years. In addition, she sells a few lunches and has a small bookstore in the same space. Odilia lives with her husband and three children. She is grateful to God because her son is about to graduate, which is a great achievement for her. Her dream is to help her two other daughters move forward since they are in primary school. Her store continues to grow each day and the sales have been a great help to her.

Odilia needs to buy various products for her store such as snack foods, corn, sugar, rice, instant soups, water, sodas, juices, and some fruit. This will also help her with her seasonal sales. She does not have enough money, so Odilia needs a loan in order to buy the things that she is lacking.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food products to sell.

loans.name: Estrellas De Wara Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DE WARA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cesaria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de celulares y accesorios de celulares, venta de ropa, venta de matracas, venta de dulces, venta de juguetes, venta de edredones, venta de mantas y ponchos, venta de repuestos de autos, venta de refrescos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cesaria es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta y costura de edredones; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió  al viajar a trabajar a Brasil, cuando volvió a Bolivia, con un poco ahorro, decide comprar una máquina de coser y empezar su propio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se puede identificar que una cliente no estas presente en la imagen, ella se encuentra en consulta médica por lo que no pudo participar en la imagen.
texts.en:
The "Estrellas de Wara" communal bank is beginning its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II regional hub. It is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which Cesaria is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include the sale of food, cell phones and accessories, clothing, noisemakers, sweets, toys, quilts, blankets and ponchos, auto parts, and soft drinks.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Cesaria. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago by invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business making and selling quilts. She learned about this business when she traveled to Brazil to work. When she returned to Bolivia with some savings, she decided to buy a sewing machine and start her own business.

She will use this loan to increase her capital by buying wholesale fabric from suppliers in the city of La Paz. After making the quilts, she will sell them at her sales stall. This type of work allows her to earn an income to support her family financially, as she is in a live-in relationship and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the institution's health offerings. One of the members is not present in the photo. She was unable to participate in the photo because she was at a medical appointment.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fabric.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es una mujer de 41 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos varones de 6 y 17 años, y su negocio el tejido de chompas.
Ella es alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y comprometida con su trabajo. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ un área rural caracterizada por el comercio agrícola por mayor, De clima templado durante todo el año. 
Gregoria es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura su vestimenta es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la realiza junto a su marido que se dedica al comercio agrícola y junto a sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia que se encuentra a media construcción; hecha de ladrillo que cuenta con electricidad y compran agua de camión cisterna. “la cisterna pasa 1 o 2 veces por semana y por diferentes calles algunas veces no estamos en el domicilio y perdemos la ración de agua, necesitamos realizar la instalación de agua con urgencia…” comenta. Su sueño es ver concluida la construcción de su casa. Ella desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para el bienestar de su familia. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando la construcción de su casa.
Es por esos motivos que Gregoria solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su baño, cocina y lavandería para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a 41-year-old woman. She is married and has two sons, who are 6 and 17 years old. She has a sweater weaving business. She is cheerful, optimistic, happy, well-tempered, responsible, and committed to her work. Gregoria is dark-skinned and short with long, black, braided hair. She wears traditional clothing (hat, shawl, and skirt). Her native tongue is Quechua, which is spoken in the place where she lives. She also speaks Spanish.

Gregoria lives with her husband, who works in agriculture, and her children, who are in school. They live in their own house, which is made of brick and is still being built. They have electricity and buy water from a cistern truck. She says, "The cistern truck passes by 1 or 2 times per week and through different streets. Sometimes we are not home, and we lose our water ration. We urgently need to instal water in our home..." Her dream is to complete the construction of her home. 

Gregoria wishes to instal drinking water in the bathroom, kitchen, and laundry room for the well-being of her family. This is her first sequence of loans with the institution in the two years that her house has been under construction.

loans.use: to instal drinking water in the bathroom, kitchen, and laundry room for the well-being of her family.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies, which were needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

She is certain that she could further improve her business if you will let her take out another loan of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to the purchase of additional calamansi scent (Panama orange), other ingredients and bottles needed for her business. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Benilda wants to have her own stall to display her products and she hopes to increase her profit by adding more items to her inventory to sell. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.*

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase calamansi scent (Panama orange), other ingredients, and bottles needed for her business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Conchita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Conchita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase bamboo, nails, rope, etc. for her fishing business.

Conchita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, nails, rope, etc. for her fishing business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 46 years old and married with six children. Susan works very hard to provide for her family.

Susan runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like sardines, soft drinks, and noodles.

Susan has been in this business for seven years.

In the future Susan would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like sardines, soft drinks, and noodles.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia is 35 years old and married with one child in school. Adelia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, etc.

Adelia has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Adelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Kathery Fernanda

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo este Cantón cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos, en el mismo su gente es amable trabajadora y alegre le gusta disfrutar de todas sus festividades organizando concierto y bailes populares en este Cantón vive y tiene su negocio la señorita Kathery una joven luchadora de 19 años ella actualmente es casada, no tienen hijos el esposo trabaja como jornalero en una finca del sector viene de una familia humilde de bajos recursos económicos lo que le impidió continuar con sus estudios y tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a su madre en los gastos del hogar y pagarse sus estudios. 
Se dedica a la producción de cerdos aprendió de este negocio junto con la mamá, trabaja un promedio de 10 horas diarias entre el negocio y el empleo que tiene en un almacén del Cantón, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de vacas productoras de leche con esta inversión mejoraran sus ingresos económicos, la señorita Kathery  agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is a settlement with a warm, humid climate. The settlement has various tourist attractions, and its people are friendly, hardworking, and happy. The people of the settlement like to enjoy their celebrations by organizing popular concerts and dances. 

Kathery lives and has her business in this settlement. She is a determined young woman who is 19 years old. She is married and does not have any children. Her husband works as a day laborer in a farm in the area. She comes from a humble family of limited resources, which kept her from finishing school. She had to go to work to help her mother with the household expenses and to pay for her studies.

She makes a living by raising pigs. She learned this business from her mother. She works an average of 10 hours a day between this business and her job at a store in the settlement. She will invest this loan in the purchase of dairy cows. With this investment, her income will improve. Kathery is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and opportunity to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows to diversify her business and improve her income.

loans.name: Orillas Del Lago Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ORILLAS DEL LAGO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cristina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de agroquímcos, venta de ganado, venta de zapatos, venta de mantas, venta de ropa deportiva.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cristina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, iniciando con un pequeño capital, el cual fue incrementando poco a poco.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz y papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la fotografía acompaña al grupo el hermano de una de las clientas que esta con un sombrero blanco, ademas una de las clientes tuvo que marcharse con urgencia a su domicilio
texts.en:
The community bank “ORILLAS DEL LAGO” will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Center Group. It consists of 8 members and is led by an executive board where Cristina is the president. The members’ business are varied: selling food, selling farming chemicals, selling cattle, selling shoes, selling tablecloths, selling athletic clothing.

The loan will benefit small entrepreneurs where Cristina is a member. She indicates that this is first time working with Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of an institution representative that visited her in her home. Today she has a business selling food. She learned this trade years ago, starting with a little cash, and her business has been growing little by little.

The loan being taken today is to increase capital (to buy rice and potato at wholesale) to make purchases from wholesale vendors in La Paz city and then make and sell products in her stand. This form of work will generate income to support her family economically, as she is married and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she enjoys the trainings that the institution offers.

In the photograph the brother of one of the group members is accompanying the group member, and is in the white hat. In addition, two group members had to leave urgently for home.

loans.use: to buy rice and potato at wholesale.

loans.name: Generación Chevere Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GENERACIÓN CHEVERE” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Josefina es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida, venta de verduras, venta de joyas, venta de llaves, servicio de salón de belleza, venta de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Josefina es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de copias de llaves de auto; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió porque desde niña a ella le gustaba observar las llaves y por eso fue su obsesión aprender la elaboración de las mismas. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de moldes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el consultorio médico que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community bank "GENERACIÓN CHEVERE" (Generation Awesome) will begin its fourth term with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II central business office. It has eight members and is run by a board of directors with Josefina as its treasurer. The members run a variety of businesses including selling clothes, cosmetics, food, vegetables, jewelry, keys, and shoes and running a beauty salon.

This loan will benefit all of the small businesses in Josefina's group. She joined five years ago ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Josefina currently runs a business copying car keys. She started this business because as a child, she liked to look at keys, and her childhood obsession led to her learning to make them.

This loan will be used to increase her capital by buying molds at wholesale. She will get these from vendors in the city of La Paz and then later sell them in her sales space. This business lets her earn money and support her family, as she is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the training and the doctor's office that the institution offers.

loans.use: buy molds for making automobile keys at wholesale

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ Y VIDA” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Venancia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de café, venta de empanadas, venta de lubricantes, venta de regalos, venta de ropa de hospital, venta de quinua.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Venancia es integrante, ella indica que es el ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando al observar el trabajo que realizaban con algunas de sus vecinas decide buscar la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de empanadas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al observar a su madre quien realizaba el mismo negocio, con un pequeño préstamo en Pro Mujer decide emprender un negocio independiente.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "LUZ Y VIDA" (Light and Life) community bank will begin its tenth term with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional hub. It has eight members and is run by a board of directors with Venancia as its president. Its members run a wide variety of businesses, including selling coffee, pastries, lubricants, gifts, hospital clothing, and quinoa.

This loan will benefit all of the small business owners in Venancia's group. She joined Pro Mujer eight years ago, entering upon noticing the work that several of her neighbors were doing. Currently, she runs a business selling empanadas, stuffed dumplings. She began this business after observing her mother, who does the same kind of work. She started her own business with a small loan from Pro Mujer.

This loan will be used to increase her capital by purchasing flour at wholesale. She will obtain it from the vendors in the city of La Paz and then use it to do her baking at her sales stand. This work lets her earn money to support her family, as she is married and has five children. When asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health clinic that the institution offers.

loans.use: buy flour at wholesale

loans.name: Azucenas De Tilata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AZUCENAS DE NUEVA TILATA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lurdes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de coca, venta de condimentos, venta de polleras, tienda de barrio, venta de verduras, venta de puertas de madera, venta de ropa, venta de camas, venta de quesos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lurdes es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con el primer crédito obtenido en Pro Mujer, aprendiendo el comercio de estos productos de su madre a quien apoyo desde niña. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Azucenas de Nueva Tilata" communal bank is beginning its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada regional hub. It is made up of nine members and is run by a board of directors, of which Lurdes is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include the sale of coca leaves, condiments, traditional skirts, vegetables, wooden parts, clothing, beds, cheese, and a neighborhood store.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Lurdes. She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago by invitation from a promoter of the institution, who came to visit her at home. She currently has a business selling vegetables. She says that she started this business with her first loan from Pro Mujer. She learned to sell these products from her mother, whom she supported from a young age.

She will use this loan to increase her capital by buying wholesale vegetables from suppliers in the city of La Paz, which she will then sell at her sales stall. This type of work allows her to generate an income to support her family financially, as she is in a live-in relationship and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the institution's health offerings.

loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
This borrower's name is Belinda. She is 41 and a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Belinda is married to Ramil and has two children. She manages their household while operating a jeepney business. They work hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Belinda owns and oversees operation of her jeepney. She has one (14-16 person capacity) jeepney. Jeepneys are the most common form of public transport throughout the many islands of the Philippines. Most of the time, the jeepneys are constantly packed with passengers. Jeepneys offer one of the cheapest ways of getting somewhere. They are one of the remnants of the American military presence in the Philippines during the second World War and are still to be seen throughout the Philippines, in many colors and all over the place. Originally, jeepneys were old American jeeps. They were used in the war against the Japanese army who occupied the Philippines for several years. After the Japanese army was defeated and the American military mission was completed, the jeeps were left by the tens of thousands on the islands in the Philippines.The Filipinos saw possibilities to make out of these jeeps. They saw a real means of transportation by making these jeeps about two meters longer and by putting two long seats in them, one on each side from the front to the back. Since then, jeepneys have been used as small buses for cheap transport of people, goods, and even sometimes little animals. Jeepney transport service is one of the stable businesses in the Philippines. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Belinda is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan which she will use for repairs of jeepney's passenger seat and to replace its tires. It is very important that her unit is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service. Her husband drives it, so she is assured that her jeepney is well taken care of. Her earnings from the jeep provide for their daily needs and the school needs of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Belinda hopes that their transport service will continue to be successful. She dreams for her children to get the best education. She prays for the safety of her husband in driving and for a better future for all of them. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for jeepney tires and the repair of its passenger seat.

loans.name: Chañucagua Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHAÑUCAHUA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: librería, tienda de barrio, tejido de mantas, venta de arena, venta de carne de charque, venta de abarrotes, venta de comida, venta de gomitas de dulces, venta de carne de vaca.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando al observar el trabajo que realizaban con algunas de sus vecinas decide buscar la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, iniciando con contratos eventuales, posteriormente decide adquirir un espacio donde comercializa sus productos diariamente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community bank “CHAÑUCAHUA” will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Center Group. It consists of 10 members and is led by an executive board where Margarita is the secretary. The members’ business are varied: bookstore, neighborhood store, weaving tablecloths, selling sand, selling meat, selling groceries, selling food, selling candy, selling beef.

The loan will benefit small entrepreneurs where Margarita is a member. She indicates that this is her second year working with Pro Mujer, joining upon observing the work they were doing with some of her neighbors and decided to seek out the institution. Today she has a business selling food. She learned this trade years ago, starting event contracts, then she decided to acquire a space where she can sell her products daily.

The loan being taken today is to increase capital to buy vegetables at wholesale to be purchased from wholesale vendors in La Paz city and then make and sell products in her stand. This form of work will generate income to support her family economically, as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she enjoys the savings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Crisanta is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Crisanta has been sustaining her business activities through the previous 31 loans she has taken out from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business in order to secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Rubelinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rubelinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Rubelinda is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rubelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Handini

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Handini, a micro-entrepreneur from Cibubur, a suburban city located at the southern border of Jakarta. Handini is married, and she and her husband have been blessed with two daughters. To support the family income, she helps her husband in running a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits and utility bill payment services to her community. She met a Ruma field staffer who introduced her to Ruma more than one year ago. She was really excited and decided to try the mobile phone airtime business.

For the last three months, Handini has been running the business really well, and now the demand for mobile phone airtime credits is increasing. Therefore, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva that will be used to process more mobile phone airtime transactions. This is the second time she applied for a loan from Kiva - the first loan was really helpful in that she now can improve her small stall.

Most of her customers are her own female neighbors who have also adopted mobile phones. As the business grows, Handini plans to add more mobile services to her community, such as a utility bill payment service.

In the photo, Handini is pictured standing in front of her stall while carrying a bluetooth printer in her hand, which she uses to print transaction receipts for utility bill payments. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela is a brave single mother she has one child he is two years old. Gabriela lives in La Paz and she pays rent Gabriela works at a hospital as a nurse assistant and she also sells christmas lights Gabriela doesn t earn to much money at the hospital so she needs a loan to purchase christmas lights in order to have more money for the holidays Gabriela is completely alone so she will apreciate a lot the help from Kiva
texts.en: Gabriela is a brave single mother she has one child he is two years old. Gabriela lives in La Paz and she pays rent Gabriela works at a hospital as a nurse assistant and she also sells Christmas lights Gabriela doesn t earn to much money at the hospital so she needs a loan to purchase Christmas lights in order to have more money for the holidays. Gabriela is completely alone so she will apreciate a lot the help from Kiva

loans.use: to purchase Christmas lights.

loans.name: Solidario Kevin Group

texts.es:
Solidario Kevin
Este solidario esta formado por doña Petrona, ella tiene 44 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares, cosméticos, y material para manualidades, en su librería ubicado en San Bartolomé Milpas Altas, desde ya hace varios años, ella esta solicitando el crédito para compra de cuadernos empastados y útiles en general, así como compra de regalos para la temporada navideña, su deseo es tener bien surtida su librería  y estar preparada para surtir a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Solidario Kevin:

This group includes Petrona, who is 44 years old. For various years, she has made a living by selling school supplies, cosmetics, and craft supplies, in her bookstore located in San Bartolomé Milpas Altas. She is requesting a loan to buy bound notebooks and supplies in general, as well as to buy gifts for the holiday season. Her wish is to have a good stock in her bookstore and be prepared to supply her customers.

loans.use: to buy materials to sell in her bookstore.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORTALEZA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, iniciando con un pequeño capital, el cual fue incrementando poco a poco.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de queso por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community bank “FORTALEZA” will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Center Group. It consists of 8 members and is led by an executive board where Juana is the secretary. The members’ business are varied: selling cheese, selling cattle.

The loan will benefit small entrepreneurs where Juana is a member. She indicates has been working with Pro Mujer for 5 years, joining at the invitation of an institution representative that visited her at her home. Today she has a business selling cheese. She learned this work years ago, starting with a little cash, and her business little by little.

The loan being taken today is to increase capital to buy cheese at wholesale to be purchased from wholesale vendors in La Paz city and then sold in her stand. This form of work will generate income to support her family economically, as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she enjoys the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cheese at wholesale.

loans.name: Delmi Sarai

texts.es: Delmi es una mujer joven de 23 años de edad luchadora con deseos de superarse en la vida y aprender cada día en el ramo de la agricultura. Quien junto a su esposo tienen su propia parcela para cultivo de café la cual esta cultivada con diferente variedad y tipos de café como ejemplo el tipo 90 y café lempira los cuales son dos tipos de productos resistentes a las plagas que han atacado las diferentes producciones de café en los alrededores. Tiene un tiempo aproximado de tres años de dedicarse a esta actividad la cual en su familia es medio y fuente de ingresos económicos para salir adelante. Gracias a ambas partes familiares tienen donde trabajar de manera propia pues sus padres les han heredado la tierra y ellos mismos instruyeron y pasaron el conocimiento apropiado sobre caficultura para obtener magnificas producciones con calidad y buen grano. A parte de esta actividad ellos tienen otros ingresos mediante la cosecha de árboles frutales como la naranja, guineos así como también granos básicos como él y maíz y frijol siendo sus clientes los diferentes intermediarios de la zona, vecinos, amigos y demás pues también son asistidos por instituciones reconocidas como Usaid, Fhia y Isem quienes proporcionan diferentes técnicas agrícolas para el café y la horticultura. Debido al factor financiero Delmi solicita su primer financiamiento para la compra de los insumos agrícolas que necesita siendo estos los que ayuden al cuidado e incremento de su plantación de café y la nueva plantilla. Sus planes seguir la lucha con el trabajo de campo y poder satisfacer las necesidades básicas tanto de la familia como del campo pues quiere formar su propio capital para ser independiente y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Delmi is a young 23-year-old woman. She is determined and motivated, with a desire to better herself in life and learn everyday in the field of agriculture. Together with her husband, they have their own piece of land to grow coffee, which is cultivated with different types of coffee beans such as type 90 and lempira, both of which are resistant to the plagues that have attacked coffee crops nearby.

For about three years, Delmi has been making a living growing coffee, which is the source of income in her family that helps them get ahead. Thanks to both sides of the family, they have an area of their own to work on since they inherited land from their parents, who instructed and passed on the necessary knowledge about coffee growing to produce quality beans very well.

Besides this occupation, Delmi and her husband earn other income by picking fruit such as oranges and bananas, as well as harvesting grains such as corn and beans. Their customers being local middlemen, neighbors, friends, and others, Delmi and her husband are also helped by recognized institutions such as USAID, FHIA, and ISEM who provide them with agricultural skills for growing coffee and gardening. 

Because of financial conditions, Delmi is requesting her first loan to buy agricultural supplies that she needs to take care of and increase the size of her coffee plantation and staff. 

Her plans are to keep working on the farm, and be able to meet the basic needs of her family and her farm. She wants to build her own capital to be independent and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help with her coffee crop.

loans.name: Aura Marina

texts.es:
Aura es una mujer  que trabaja con la mente puesta en un mejor futuro para sus hijos es por ello que día con día se esfuerza para alcanzar sus metas; ella tiene 50 años vive junto a su esposo en San Pablo Jocopilas. 

Aura es una mujer que le gusta cocinar, pues hace 5 años ella se decidió buscar una actividad para ayudar a su esposo para sacar adelante a sus 5 hijos que aun están estudiando. Pues ella ahora se dedica a la venta de tamales y chuchitos, ella ofrece este producto en las diferentes tiendas de su comunidad y como ya es muy reconocida también le llegan a comprar a su casa. 

Con la poca ganancia que genera el negocio ella ayuda a su esposo a contribuir a los gastos que genera la familia. Aura quiero y ama mucho a su familia,  para que tengan lo necesario,  pues una de las necesidades que hay dentro de su casa es la construcción de un baño, para que su familia tenga un lugar donde ducharse, pues como Aura no cuenta con suficiente capital para hacerlo, ella propone a su esposo en buscar un préstamo y que entre los dos lo pagarían, la meta de Aura es tener su baño para  la higiene de su familia.
texts.en:
Aura is a woman who works with her mind set on a better future for her children.  This is why she strives each day to reach her goals.  She is 50 years old, and lives with her husband in San Pablo Jocopilas.

Aura is a woman who enjoys cooking.  Five years ago, she decided to look for an activity to help her husband provide for their 5 children, who are still in school.  Aura now has a business selling tamales and "chuchitos" (small Guatemalan tamales).  She sells these products to the various stores in her community, and as she is very well-known, people also come to her house to buy her tamales.

With her modest earnings from her business, she helps her husband to cover the household expenses.  Aura really loves her family and wants them to have everything they need.  One of their needs right now is to build a bathroom inside the house so that her family can have a place to shower.  However, Aura lacks the capital to do this, so she suggested to her husband that they look for a loan which the two of them could pay off.  Aura's goal is to have a bathroom for her family's hygiene.

loans.use: to build a bathroom

loans.name: Angeles Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANGELES” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Victoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de calzados, venta de productos de belleza, venta de juguetes, venta de aceites y huevos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Victoria es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de juguetes; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia al observar que este producto era altamente comercializado en el mercado. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de juguetes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella está casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen esta ausente una cliente, la misma se encuentra en el consultorio médico realizando los controles preventivos.
texts.en:
The "Angeles" communal bank is beginning its tenth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II regional hub. This group is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which Victoria is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include the sale of footwear, beauty products, toys, oil, and eggs.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Victoria. She says that she joined Pro Mujer seven years ago by invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling toys. She says that she started this business several years ago on her own initiative when she saw that this product is highly commercialized in the marketplace.

She will use this loan to increase her capital by buying wholesale toys from suppliers in the city of La Paz, which she will later sell at her sales stall. This type of work allows her to generate an income to support her family financially, as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the savings offered by the institution.

One client is not present in the photo because she was at a medical appointment for a preventative check-up.

loans.use: to buy wholesale toys.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is a fisherman from Iloilo, Philippines. He is 45 years old, married and has seven children. Jerry has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income.

Jerry is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With a loan, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market for a good price.

Jerry dreams of improving his fishing business and making it a success. Moreover, he also wants to save money for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items for his fishing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for bronze souvenirs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for cloth printing

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is 30 years old. She has worked in sales since childhood - helping her mother – and, five years ago, she decided to start her own business selling beauty products. Her business was going well and she was able to rent a kiosk. However, a year later, she was diagnosed with multi-drug resistant TB (MDR-TB) and had to stop working in order to undergo medical treatment. She was unable to work for over a year and was greatly affected by side effects from treatment. Her mother and sister supported her during this time; she also received support from Partners In Health Peru through nutritional supplements and medical tests. Since successfully completing treatment, the borrower has joined the organization’s Income Generation project, resuming cosmetics sales at a local market. At present, she is seeking a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase comestics for sales

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 51 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Teresita works very hard to provide for her family.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like sardines, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

Teresita has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like sardines, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 46 years old and has four children. With two children in school, Lerma works very hard to provide for them.

Lerma runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo and cigarettes. Lerma has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Lerma would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo and cigarettes.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 39 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Christine works very hard to provide for them.

Christine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, beverages, etc.

Christine has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Christine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Rose Jean

texts.en:
Rose Jean works hard to support her family. Rose Jean is married and has a buying and selling of fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like fruits and vegetables.

Rose Jean has been in this business for two years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling meat.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Annabelle is 49 years old and has one child in school.

Annabelle has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines and also earns an income from a general store. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Annabelle requested a 5,000 PHP bridge loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her stall to restart her business activities.

Annabelle has been in this business for five years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her stall

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Abdul, a micro-entrepreneur from north of Bogor, a semi-urban area located about two hours drive from Jakarta. Abdul is single and he lives with more than six family members in the family home. 

Abdul runs a small stall and sells snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credits. He met a Ruma field staff member who introduced him to Ruma about six months ago. He was really excited and decided to try the mobile phone airtime business. For the last three months, Abdul has been running the business very well and now the demand for mobile phone airtime is increasing. Therefore, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva that will be used to process more mobile phone airtime transactions. As the business runs, Abdul plans to add more mobile services to his community, such as e-commerce for low income communities, which is a new service from Ruma that enables people in rural areas to buy products via Ruma agent's small shops, like Abdul's. In the photo, Abdul is pictured standing inside his stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime and utility bill payment transactions in his community

loans.name: Buntha's Group

texts.en: The members of Buntha’s group live in a rural village in Kompomg Thom province in Cambodia. Buntha works as farm laborer, and she also does extra work as a furniture and electronics repairer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as saving time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Lon's Group

texts.en: The members of Lon’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Lon makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does work as an officer and seller, buying and selling medicines and cakes to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as saving time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Patricia es una señora de nacionalidad colombiana,  a sus 40 años de edad es madre soltera de 2 hijos la mayor de 12 años y el menor de 10 años de edad que muy contentos asisten a la escuela, ella se dedica a la trabajar al jornal y a la crianza de animales menores y con el dinero del crédito va a comprar pollos, Patricia tiene la aspiración de seguir trabajando en Ecuador para quedarse viviendo en Ecuador ya que vivir en este país se tiene una vida muy tranquila, ya que salieron de Colombia debido a que en este país existe mucha delincuencia y enfrentamientos entre la guerrilla y los militares.
texts.en: Patricia is a Colombian woman, 40 year old single mother of two children ages 12 and 10. Her children attend school. She works as a day laborer and raises small animals. With the loan she is going to buy chickens. Patricia has the goal of continue working in Ecuador in order to remain living in Ecuador as in Ecuador she has a very tranquil life. They left Colombia because there is a lot of delinquency and confrontations between the guerrillas and military.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huong, born in 1976, is a woman of the Kinh ethnic majority. Her family consists of her husband, her son and her. Currently, her family lives in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from her meager salary, which is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and have an amount left to save. Bur that amount is not enough to pay for her son’s education fees. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to pay for her son’s education fees.

She believes the loan will help her pay the education costs of her son, and he will have better learning conditions to have a bright future. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s education fees

loans.name: Ayrampitos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AYRAMPITOS” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ruth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cebolla, venta de polleras, venta de mantas, venta de frutas, venta de flores, venta de carne, tienda de barrio, venta de escobas y pilas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ruth es integrante, ella indica que es el quinto año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando al observar el trabajo que realizaban con algunas de sus vecinas decide buscar la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de polleras; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió posteriormente haber estudiado corte y confección en una institución técnica.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina de coser) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera aun no tiene hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Ayrampitos" communal bank is beginning its sixth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional hub. It is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which Ruth is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include the sale of onions, traditional skirts, blankets, fruit, flowers, meat, brooms, batteries and a neighborhood store.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Ruth. She says that this is her fifth year with Pro Mujer. When she saw the work that they did with some of her neighbors, so she decided to join the institution. She currently has a business selling traditional skirts. She says that she started this business after studying dressmaking at a technical institute.

She will use this loan to increase her capital by buying a sewing machine from a wholesale supplier in the city of La Paz. After making her products, she will sell them at her sales stall. This type of work allows her to earn an income to support her family financially. She is single and still does not have any children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the institution's health offerings.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 51 years old and married. She lives in Sindangan. For the past three years, she has been a farmer. She earns 2,000 PHP each month and is a new member of PMPC. Fe is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for good growth of rice

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the necessary capital to start up a sari-sari, or general, store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Helen is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Recently, she took out a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil and soy sauce. 

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

loans.name: Khonry's Group

texts.en: The members of Khonry’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Khonry makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does work as an officer and teacher to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as saving time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en: The members of Sopheak’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sopheak makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does  work as an officer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as saving time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en: The members of Sary’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sary makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as saving time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Bunthoeun's Group

texts.en: The members of Bunthoeun’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Bunthoeun makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a teacher to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as saving time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lien is a Thai ethnic woman who has been participating in the credit and saving program since January 2010. She lives with her husband and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family lives mainly on cultivation and animal breeding, so their income after deducting all costs, is just enough to cover food and education fees for her children. Her eldest son attends grade five and her youngest son attends kindergarten. She wants to build a toilet but she does not have enough money to do it.  Therefore, she wants to take out a loan for this purpose.

She will find an extra job to earn the money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time and she hopes the loan will help her improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AZUCENAS” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Celia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cebolla, venta de polleras, venta de mantas, venta de frutas, venta de flores, venta de carne, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Celia es integrante, ella indica que es el séptimo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando al observar el trabajo que realizaban con algunas de sus vecinas decide buscar la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace diez años, iniciando con un pequeño capital, el cual fue incrementando poco a poco con los créditos obtenidos en Pro Mujer.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frutas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se encuentran dos personas que acompañan al grupo, el esposo de una de las clientes mismo que esta vestido con una chaqueta negra y la madre de una cliente que es una persona de la tercera edad.
texts.en:
The "Azucenas" communal bank is beginning its ninth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi regional hub. It is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which Celia is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include the sale of onions, traditional skirts, blankets, fruit, flowers, and meat, as well as a neighborhood store.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Celia. She says that this is her seventh year with Pro Mujer, which she joined when she saw the work they were doing with some of her neighbors. She currently has a business selling fruit. She says that she started this business ten years ago with a little capital, and she has been growing her business little by little with the loans from Pro Mujer.

She will use this loan to increase her capital by buying wholesale fruit from suppliers in the city of La Paz, which she will later sell at her sales stall. This type of work allows her to earn an income to support her family financially, as she is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the institution's health offerings.

In the photo, there are two people who accompany the group: the husband of one of the members, wearing a black jacket, and the elderly mother of one of the members.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruit.

loans.name: Luis Francisco

texts.es:
Luis  es señor casado, con dos hijos a su cargo a los que le proporciona su ayuda para su desarrollo, este señor se desempeña como maestrao de educacion primaria, en una comunidad rural donde sale desde  las 05 de la mañana por poder estar a las 7:30 de la mañana donde tiene que hacer un largo recorrido de muchos kilometros para poder llegar a impartir el pan de la enseñanza.
Este señor visito la oficina de Ceprodel para solicitar  el cuarto financiamiento ya que tiene la necesidad de  de mejorar  el techo y paredes de su vivienda  y lo invertiria en la  compra de una ventana, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra. los que le vendria a mejoras sus condiciones y nivel de vida  a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a married man with two children under his care. He provides them with support to help them move forward. Luis works as an elementary school teacher in a rural community. He sets out at 5 am every morning in order to arrive at 7:30 am. He has to make a long journey of many kilometers in order to share his knowledge with his students.

Luis visited the Ceprodel office to request his fourth loan because he needs to improve the roof and walls of his home. He will use the loan to buy a window, cement, and sand and to pay for laborers. This way, he will improve his family's living conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a window, cement, and sand and to pay for laborers.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is an industrious woman residing in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She toils the land and grows rice, corn and cassava. She is married and has two children who are 14 and 8 years old, respectively. To have an additional source of income, she sells vegetables to the locals in her community. Her husband works as a rice mill operator. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizers and additional capital for her vegetable vending business. With this loan, her farm will gain a higher yield and she will be able to sell a variety of vegetables to her respective customers. In these ways, her income will slowly improve and she will be paying her obligations and other household expenses. Lorna will continue support the needs of her growing children, including a quality education.

Lorna would like to improve and expand both businesses to be productive and in this way, she could help alleviate her status of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and additional capital for her vegetable vending business

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara tiene 43 años de edad, vive en casa familiar, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén departamento de Lambayeque, en la sierra norte del Perú. Ella vive en la parte rural de este distrito contando con servicios de agua y luz, las actividades principales que se desarrollan son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

La actividad que realiza es la venta de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros) y frutas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, además vende refrescos como soya, chicha, cebada. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para su tienda y mayor cantidad de frutas de estación y bebidas gaseosas, lo cual le generará mayores ingresos y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sara is 43-years old. She lives in her family's home with her son in Pucará District, Jaén Department in Lambayeque, in Perú's northern mountains. She lives in a rural part of the district that has water and electricity. The main businesses of the people who live there are agriculture, livestock and shops.

Sara's business is selling groceries (rice, sugar, cooking oil and other items) and fruit. Her business is located in her home. She also sells beverages such as soy milk, "chica" (a fermented maize drink) and "cebada" (a barley drink). Sara has experience in the business and very good personal as well as work references in the area. The loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of products for her store and more seasonal vegetables and carbonated beverages. This will generate a better income for her and then she will be able to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of products for her store and more seasonal fruit and carbonated beverages.

loans.name: Cerlita

texts.en:
Cerlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 1 year. She earns additional income from farming rice and from a general store.

Cerlita is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Cerlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Daniel Giovani

texts.es: Daniel es un  joven trabajador  de 22 años de edad, el creció con sus padres que viven en el campo y los ingresos los obtiene de los sembríos y  crianza de animales, Daniel trabaja al jornal y también cuando le contratan se dedica a cargar madera, este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos ya que comenta que su madre le enseña a criar sus animales, este joven es muy positivo y aspira mejorar su negocio y seguir trabajando para forjar su futuro.
texts.en: Daniel is a 22 year old hard-working young man. He grew up with his parents who live in the countryside and he obtains his income from his crops and raising animals. Daniel works as a day laborer and also when he is contracted to haul wood. This loan will be used to buy pigs as he comments that his mother taught him how to raise animals. This young man is very positive and aspires to improve his business and continue working to create his future.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Jhomaira Abigail

texts.es: Jhomaira tiene 24 años de edad es soltera vive con sus padres en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos solicita el credito para invertir en el negocio ya que ella vende por las calles los zapatos su sueño es tener un local grande para poder vender mas y brindar un buen servicio. En su tiempo libre le gusta tejer y escuchar musica.
texts.en: Jhomaira, 24, is single and lives with her parents in Guaranda in the province of Bolivar. She makes a living selling shoes. She will invest this loan in her business, as she sells her shoes on the streets. Her dream is to have a large property so she can sell more and offer a good service. In her free time, she enjoys weaving and listening to music.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Sinak's Group

texts.en:
Sinak’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sinak makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs, and she also has extra work as a farmer and taxi driver to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Aura Florencia

texts.es: AURA FLORENCIA: Es una mujer indígena que pertenece a la etnia miskita, es originaria de Waspam; es amable y emprendedora, tiene 40 años de edad, casada con dos hijos mayores de edad, que estudian su carrera universitaria. Tiene un pequeño negocio de ropa y calzado en el mercado municipal. Está solicitando un préstamo para incrementar su mercadería de ropa y calzado que comprará en Managua y Masaya; lugares donde puede obtener precios más favorables que le permitirá también vender a precios favorable a sus clientela en Waspam e incrementar sus ingresos. Ella sueña con diversificar sus productos y también poder  trabajar en actividades agrícolas y pecuarias, especialmente en la crianza de gallinas y cerdos para comercializarlos.
texts.en:
