Aura Florencia is an indigenous woman who belongs to the Miskito ethnic group.  She is originally from Waspam and is kind and enterprising.  She is 40 years old, married, and has two adult children who attend university.  

She has a small clothing and shoe store at the municipal market.  She is requesting this loan to increase her merchandise of clothing and shoes, which she will purchase in Managua and Masaya.  In those places, she can get more favorable prices that will allow her to also sell to her customers in Waspam at favorable prices and increase her income.  She dreams of diversifying her products and also being able to work in farming and livestock, especially raising chickens and pigs to sell.

loans.use: to increase her clothing and shoe merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es: María es una señora trabajadora, tiene 4 hijos pero solo vive con una y 2 nietos, ella creció en el campo y comenta que en este lugar sus fuentes de empleo son la agricultura, trabajar al jornal y a la crianza de animales, ella tiene unas chancheras de madera para tener chanchas grandes  de reproductoras, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchas  ya que es bueno este negocio cuando se les vende las crías, la aspiración de Maria es de trabajar ya que prácticamente se esta quedando sola y tiene que tener para sus gastos.
texts.en: María is a hardworking woman. She has four children, but she only lives with one of them and two grandchildren. She grew up in the countryside and says that in this area, the sources of income are farming, working as a day laborer, and raising animals. She has wooden pigpens to keep large pigs to breed. She will invest this loan in the purchase of pigs, since this is a good business when she sells the piglets. María's goal is to work, since she is virtually alone and she has to have money for her expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 38 years old and married with four children. All of her children are in school, and Arlene works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Arlene has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Irlanda Lizeth

texts.es: IRLANDA LIZETH: Es una señora maestra originaria de Waspam  que es situada a orillas del Wangkí, fronterizo con Honduras; tiene 35 años de edad, casada con 4 hijos: Dos adolescentes que están estudiando su secundaria y 2 en primaria. Su casa es de madera y  actualmente necesita reparación.  Es por eso que solicitan un préstamo para mejorar su vivienda. Con el préstamo va comprar madera cepillada, postes de madera, clavos y pagar la mano de obra. Ella y su marido sueñan con tener una casa bonita de cemento, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y ambiente para toda su familia
texts.en: IRLANDA LIZETH is a teacher and originally from Waspam, located on the banks of the Wangki on the border with Honduras. She is 35 years old, married, with 4 children: two teenager who attend high school and two in elementary school. Her house is made of wood and today is in need of repairs. Therefore she seeks a loan to improve her home. With the loan she is going to buy planed wood, wooden posts, nails, and pay for labor. She and her husband dream of having a very pretty cement home, with better safety and ambiance for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy planed wood, wooden posts, nails, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Los Pinos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS PINOS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paulina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de artesanías, tienda de barrio, costura de mantas, venta de leche.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paulina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, ya que desde niña apoyaba en su negocio familiar, posteriormente decide emprender un negocio independiente.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de conservas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es divorciada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Community Association "LOS PINOS" will commence its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. It consists of eight members and is headed by a board of directors of which Paulina is President. The businesses run by members of the community association are numerous, but among them are: the selling of artisan goods, a neighborhood store, sewing blankets, and selling milk. 

The loan will benefit the group of microentrepreneurs of which Paulina is a member. She notes that this is the first time that the group has worked with Pro Mujer, on the invitation of a consultant of the organization who visited her home. Currently she owns a neighborhood store; she disclosed that she undertook to establish the business many years ago, as she helped with the family business since she was a child and later decided to start her own independent business. 

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to purchase wholesale canned goods) that will be obtained from the wholesale vendors of the city of La Paz and later sell these goods in the retail space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is divorced and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods wholesale
